title: Lead Data Scientist
description:
Job Title: Lead Data Scientist

Cox Communications invites a dynamic professional to join our Network Analytics Reliability Enablement Team (NARE) as a Lead Data Scientist. This key role will report to a Manager of Data Science and play a pivotal part in designing and developing analytics applications for our Service Health platform.

Key Responsibilities:
• Analytics Application Architecture:
• Design Patterns: Develop repeatable patterns for analytics application use cases.
• Service Planning: Plan and document essential logic paths, service architecture, and data storage solutions.
• Service Assessment: Assess existing services for maintainability and scalability, identifying opportunities for simplification.
• Design Principles: Focus on observability, reusability, and scalability in your design.
• Development:
• Application Development: Create analytics applications adhering to industry best practices for design and testing.
• Cloud Development: Utilize the AWS ecosystem to develop scalable and maintainable solutions.
• Testing Strategies: Implement unit testing strategies, end-to-end testing, and A/B testing.
• Advanced Modeling: Build advanced data models to analyze signal data and network infrastructure.
• Problem-Solving: Tackle complex problems with exceptional software development skills.

Qualifications:
• Minimum Requirements:
• Education and Experience: Bachelor's degree in a related field and 4 years of relevant experience, or a combination of education and experience.
• Programming Skills: 4 years of experience with Python, Java, or C#.
• Cloud Experience: 2 years of cloud experience in a software engineering or data science capacity.
• Big Data Experience: 1 year of experience with big data systems such as Hive, Athena, or Big Query.
• Analytics Experience: Experience in analytics application design and development.
• Communication Skills: Strong communication skills to convey complex technical topics to non-technical stakeholders.
• Version Control: Familiarity with version control systems like Git or Bitbucket, and CI/CD pipelines like Jenkins.
• In-Memory Storage: Experience with in-memory storage solutions like DynamoDB or Redis.
• Preferred Qualifications:
• Software Engineering Experience: 6 years of software engineering experience.
• AWS Services Knowledge: Knowledge of AWS Services such as Lambda, Step Functions, CloudWatch, EventBridge, EC2, EMR, RedShift, SQS, RDS, IAM, or Kubernetes.
• Telecommunications Industry Experience: Experience in the telecommunications or cable industry.
• Automated Test Design: Background in automated test design and implementation.
• Data Store Selection: Experience selecting data stores for large-scale applications.
• Neptune Experience: AWS Neptune experience.

Compensation:

The compensation for this role ranges from $99,000.00 to $165,000.00 annually, varying based on factors such as location and the candidate's qualifications.

Benefits:

Cox Communications offers flexible vacation policies, paid holidays, and wellness hours, along with additional leave for bereavement, voting, jury duty, volunteering, military service, and parental leave.

About Cox Communications:

Cox Communications is the largest private telecom company in the U.S., serving six million homes and businesses. Our commitment to our employees is reflected in our comprehensive benefits and award-winning culture.

Cox is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer; all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, national origin, sex, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: AI and Machine Learning Engineer
description:
A Career Defining Moment: Join Our Team
Are you ready to take your career to the next level? Do you want to work on cutting-edge AI and ML projects that will transform the way businesses operate? Join our team at ServiceNow as a Senior Software Engineer specializing in the ServiceNow Platform and AI/ML. In this role, you will play a critical part in advancing our Finance POD's capabilities by leveraging AI technologies. Your expertise will enable transformative solutions, including customer zero implementations and the creation of custom AI/GenAI/Agentic AI solutions to address complex finance-related challenges.

What We Offer
A collaborative and dynamic work environment where you can learn and grow with talented peers. Opportunities to work on diverse and challenging projects that will help you develop new skills and expand your knowledge. A competitive compensation package and comprehensive benefits program. Professional development opportunities, including training, mentorship, and access to cutting-edge tools and technologies.

title: Software Engineer (Data Engineering)
description:
At T-Mobile, we invest in YOU! Our Total Rewards Package ensures that employees get the same big love we give our customers. All team members receive a competitive base salary and compensation package - this is Total Rewards. Employees enjoy multiple wealth-building opportunities through our annual stock grant, employee stock purchase plan, 401(k), and access to free, year-round money coaches. That's how we're UNSTOPPABLE for our employees!

Are you ready to join the Un-carrier movement?

If so, our team is searching for a Software Engineer to work with a team of other software engineers, network, and systems engineers to craft, implement, and deploy software which meet customer's requirements, scales easily, removes the limitations of traditional networking solutions, and supports deployment in highly available environments. Our team participates and leads in architecture and design of various software components using technologies such as virtualization, micro services, SDN, NFV, and Big Data platforms and technologies. We work on technical assignments that are semi routine or greenfield in nature but recognize the need for occasional deviation from accepted practice! Our SWE's normally follow established procedures on routine work and require instructions only on new assignments.

We are a team that encourages innovation and advocate an agile and open approach, truly working and playing in the Un-carrier way!

Responsibilities:

Data Analysis and Visualization:
• Develop dashboards and reports in Tableau and Power BI to provide meaningful insights and visualizations that support data-driven decision-making across the organization.

Data Management and Integration:
• Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL processes using cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.

Technical Engineering Services:
• Supports engineering projects by developing software solutions; conducting tests and inspections; preparing reports and calculations. Encouraged to mentor associate engineers on occasion.

Technical Leadership:
• Collaborate with technical teams and applies system expertise to deliver technical solutions.
• Continuously learning new technologies.

Technical Writing:
• Writes basic documentation on how technology works and supply clear documentation for new code and systems used.
• Documenting systems designs, presentations, and business requirements for consumption at the engineer level.

Technology Strategy:
• Contributes to new technologies to deliver business goals.
• Understands current technology supporting business goals using system protocols, how systems operate and data flows. Encouraged to independently develop a full software stack while understanding the building blocks, interactions, dependencies, and tools required to complete software and automation work.
• Partner with system engineers to define system requirement and/or vital requirements for automation.

Innovation
• Presents new insights which improve an existing system/process/service using new frameworks.
• Express fresh opinions based on independent study of the industry.
• Review current company processes to highlight questions to drive process refinement.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
• 2+ yrs technical engineering experience.
• Experience with Tableau and PowerBI
• Experience writing SQL queries.
• Ability to craft, develop, and implement ETL processes.
• Ability to write and review Java code.
• Experience in an Agile environment.
• Experience in Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery tools, and GitLab preferred.
• Experience in Kubernetes preferred.
• Experience working in a cloud environment (Azure, AWS) preferred.

Education:
• Bachelor's Degree Computer Science or Engineering
• At least 18 years of age
• Legally authorized to work in the United States

Travel:
• Travel Required (Yes/No):Yes

DOT Regulated:
• DOT Regulated Position (Yes/No):No
• Safety Sensitive Position (Yes/No):No

Base Pay Range: $92,500 - $166,800

Corporate Bonus Target: 15%

The pay range above is the general base pay range for a successful candidate in the role. The successful candidate's actual pay will be based on various factors, such as work location, qualifications, and experience, so the actual starting pay will vary within this range.

At T-Mobile, employees in regular, non-temporary roles are eligible for an annual bonus or periodic sales incentive or bonus, based on their role. Most Corporate employees are eligible for a year-end bonus based on company and/or individual performance and which is set at a percentage of the employee's eligible earnings in the prior year. Certain positions in Customer Care are eligible for monthly bonuses based on individual and/or team performance. To find the pay range for this role based on hiring location, https://paylookup.t-mobile.com/paylookup?reqID=REQ270158¶dox=1

At T-Mobile, our benefits exemplify the spirit of One Team, Together! A big part of how we care for one another is working to ensure our benefits evolve to meet the needs of our team members. Full and part-time employees have access to the same benefits when eligible. We cover all of the bases, offering medical, dental and vision insurance, a flexible spending account, 401(k), employee stock grants, employee stock purchase plan, paid time off and up to 12 paid holidays - which total about 4 weeks for new full-time employees and about 2.5 weeks for new part-time employees annually - paid parental and family leave, family building benefits, back-up care, enhanced family support, childcare subsidy, tuition assistance, college coaching, short- and long-term disability, voluntary AD&D coverage, voluntary accident coverage, voluntary life insurance, voluntary disability insurance, and voluntary long-term care insurance. We don't stop there - eligible employees can also receive mobile service & home internet discounts, pet insurance, and access to commuter and transit programs! To learn about T-Mobile's amazing benefits, check outwww.t-mobilebenefits.com.

Never stop growing!
As part of the T-Mobile team, you know the Un-carrier doesn't have a corporate ladder-it's more like a jungle gym of possibilities! We love helping our employees grow in their careers, because it's that shared drive to aim high that drives our business and our culture forward. By applying for this career opportunity, you're living our values while investing in your career growth-and we applaud it. You're unstoppable!

T-Mobile USA, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All decisions concerning the employment relationship will be made without regard to age, race, ethnicity, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, religious affiliation, marital status, citizenship status, veteran status, the presence of any physical or mental disability, or any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. Discrimination, retaliation or harassment based upon any of these factors is wholly inconsistent with how we do business and will not be tolerated.

Talent comes in all forms at the Un-carrier. If you are an individual with a disability and need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know by emailing ApplicantAccommodation@t-mobile.com or calling 1-844-873-9500. Please note, this contact channel is not a means to apply for or inquire about a position and we are unable to respond to non-accommodation related requests.

title: Data Science Lead - Sr. Python Developer
description:
In this exciting opportunity, you will have the chance to leverage your technical expertise as a Data Science Lead to drive business growth and innovation. With a strong background in Python development and a proven track record of delivering results-driven projects, you will lead the charge in cloud modernization efforts.
• You will work closely with cross-functional teams to design and implement data-driven solutions, utilizing your expertise in Databricks, Python, SQL, and other relevant technologies.
• As a seasoned professional, you will have a deep understanding of cloud technologies (Azure, GCP, AWS, etc.) and databases (SQL Server, NoSQL/Mongo), which will enable you to drive effective decision-making within the organization.
• We are seeking a candidate with at least 5 years of experience in Python development and 2 or more years of project leadership experience.

title: AI/ML Developer
description:
HealthLink Dimensions, LLC is a leading technology company that collaborates with the nation's largest pharmaceutical companies, hospitals, health plans, and marketing agencies to provide a comprehensive database of healthcare professionals.

The AI/ML Engineer role requires expertise in Machine Learning Operations (MLOps), ML Engineering, Data Science, Large Language Models (LLMs), and software engineering principles.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
• Contribute to the research and development of AI/ML projects impacting products and customers.
• Build and train machine learning models to solve specific problems and optimize performance and accuracy.
• Apply ML expertise to train models, validate accuracy, and deploy at scale to production environments.
• Adhere to best practices in MLOps, LLMOps, Data Science, and software engineering for clean, efficient, and reliable code delivery.
• Maintain model performance, making adjustments as needed to ensure accuracy and reliability.
• Analyze structured and unstructured data from various sources to discover patterns and features necessary for automation.

Required Skills and Qualifications:
• Knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as time series, anomaly detection, clustering, association, and deep learning.
• Proficiency in programming languages like Python and R.
• Strong software engineering skills, including SQL, Agile, UX, Cloud architecture.
• Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI.
• Bachelor's or master's degree in related fields, such as Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science, Analytics, Machine Learning, AI.
• Experience building production-quality systems with AI-related models, frameworks, and toolsets.

Benefits:
• Hybrid position with two days in office per week.
• Growth opportunities, promoting career advancement.
• Comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, life insurance.
• Employer contributions to Health Savings Accounts (HSA).
• 401(k) plan with a 4% company match.
• Paid Time Off policy, including philanthropic work.

title: Educator Preparation Research Analyst & Project Manager
description:
Additional Information
* Agency Logo:
* Requisition ID: EDU091A
* Number of Openings: 1
* Advertised Salary: $73,677\\.24
* Shift: Day Job

  
DUTIES \\& RESPONSIBILITIES:



The mission of the Georgia Professional Standards Commission is to build the best prepared, best qualified, and most ethical workforce in the nation. The Georgia Professional Standards Commission sets and applies high standards for the preparation, certification, and continued licensing of Georgia public educators.

  



The Educator Preparation Division is committed to ensuring educator preparation programs prepare effective educators capable of meeting the needs of all Georgia learners. Primary responsibilities of the Division include establishing and enforcing standards and requirements for the preparation of teachers, service personnel and school administrators; providing outreach and assistance to ensure understanding of standards and requirements; reviewing, approving, and monitoring educator preparation providers (EPPs) and programs that prepare individuals for state educator certification; regularly monitoring, analyzing, and using program performance data to drive improvements to state policies, and EPP and program design and operation; and notifying the public about the approval and performance of EPPs and programs. Primary functions include policy development; outreach and technical assistance; and preparation provider and program review, approval, and monitoring. These functions are carried out by Educator Preparation staff in two departments: Non\\-Traditional Preparation and Traditional Preparation, as well as a Business Support Specialist, Research Analyst and Project Manager, and Division Director.

  



The Educator Preparation Research Analyst \\& Project Manager position is a non\\-supervisory role developed to address the evolving needs of the Division resulting from the implementation of a number of educator preparation and certification reforms. The individual in this role will report to the Division Director and work closely with Educator Preparation Division leaders, as well as other agency leaders to regularly compile, analyze, and interpret Preparation Program Effectiveness Measures (PPEMs) and other educator preparation, certification, and employment data; produce reports for staff, stakeholders, and the public; ensure various data sources are used regularly and appropriately to monitor the delivery and quality of Division or agency projects; to monitor the performance of educator preparation providers and programs; and to inform policy development or revisions. The individual selected for this position will be expected to quickly develop an understanding of the goals, projects, and operations of the Educator Preparation Division, as well as GaPSC databases and reporting systems and the data generated by each. Vital to the success of this position will be the ability to establish and implement routines for monitoring progress, successfully manage multiple responsibilities simultaneously, and the ability to establish and maintain positive working relationships with agency staff and stakeholders.

  




Responsibilities

  



1\\. Data Analysis, Interpretation, and Reporting



a) Compile and extract data from agency databases for the purpose of analysis using SQL



b) Clean and restructure complex data from multiple sources for the purpose of analysis using MS Excel, SPSS, and other tools



c) Regularly analyze and interpret educator preparation data to include educator preparation data; assessment data; educator employment data; approval process data; supply and demand data; and related certification and ethics data.



d) Develop visual representations, trends, and program\\-specific reports that drive policy decisions



e) Collaborate with other staff to design reports and dashboards for EPPs and the public, to be published in a variety of formats.



f) Collaborate with staff to design protocols and routines for in\\-depth data analysis and reporting for the purposes of improving state policy and implementation of policy in educator preparation programs.



g) Create data visualizations to be presented to internal and external audiences, conveying program enrollment and completion trends, program completer employment and retention rates, and vacancy rates



h) Occasionally present education data to non\\-technical audiences



i) Fulfill ad\\-hoc requests from stakeholders including other government agencies for data that GaPSC collects and maintains



j) Design and publish reports that tell the story of the Georgia teaching workforce pipeline for state\\-level decision\\-makers



k) Collect data internally for assessing Educator Preparation division effectiveness



2\\. Preparation Program Effectiveness Measures (PPEMs)



a) Annually calculate and validate Georgia’s data model for evaluating teacher preparation programs, the Preparation Program Effectiveness Measures (PPEMs)



b) Annually administer surveys of Georgia educator preparation program completers, inductees in the education workforce, and employers of inductees



c) In conjunction with IT staff, update and maintain data dashboards conveying program quality data for internal and public audiences



3\\. Project Management



Guide the Educator Preparation division project management process through the following:



a) Providing tools and resources to the Division Director and Program directors for setting strategic goals and tracking their completion



b) Managing the schedule of department “stocktake” meetings tracking progress toward strategic goals and projects



c) Guiding individual project owners in the creation of detailed plans to implement those projects, the setting of measures of success for each project, and the assessment of progress throughout project implementation



d) Collecting data and other evidence upon which projects will be evaluated



e) In department “stocktake” meetings, facilitating group discussion toward a shared understanding of success and clear next steps for each project



4\\. Other Responsibilities



The individual in this role may be asked to perform other duties including but not limited to:



a) Develop training materials related to/resulting from project plans, deliverables, outcomes, and related data;


b) Lead or support stakeholder advisory groups and task forces to share data and gather input on project quality, continuous improvement, and sustainability;



c) Participate in planning and implementation of division or agency\\-wide conferences, workshops, and/or training events;



d) Provide training to agency staff on data analysis, interpretation, and visual representation of data.

  



ENTRY QUALIFICATIONS:



High school diploma/GED with five (5\\) years of job\\-related experience in planning analysis, analyzing data, designing surveys, preparing and writing reports of findings or work related to the area of assignment; or two (2\\) years of experience required at the lower level Research Analyst 2 (EDP041\\) or position equivalent.

  


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:


* Completion of a Master’s degree or Doctoral Degree (PhD or EdD) in data analytics, data science, educational statistics, research methods, or a related field and four years of work experience involving data analysis, research, or information management; or equivalent experience.


* Demonstrated expertise in statistical analysis or academic research.


* Work experience with a university department/school of education, state department of education, regional education service agency \\[RESA], or education\\-related organization.


* Knowledge of GaPSC policies related to the preparation and certification of educators.


* Familiarity with Georgia B/P\\-12 and or higher education policy.


* Competency in the technical tools of data analysis as demonstrated by:
* Familiarity and/or experience with SQL


* Familiarity and/or experience with SPSS, SAS, or an equivalent statistics and analytics software engine


* Familiarity and/or experience with PowerBI as a reporting and dashboarding tool.
* Competency in collaboration and leadership as demonstrated by the ability to work cooperatively with internal and external customers to achieve common goals.
* Competency in reasoning as demonstrated by:


* Ability to understand complex systems through knowledge, insight, and systematic analysis


* Ability to apply complicated sequences of rules to discern patterns, trends, and relationships and to draw conclusions


* Ability to recognize relationships among multiple, parallel sequences of information or events


* Ability to systematically analyze multifaceted problems and design solutions to these problems.
* Competency in oral and written communication as demonstrated by:


* Ability to explain technical subjects to a non\\-technical audience


* Ability to generate compelling written documents using correct grammar and spelling, vocabulary appropriate to the audience, and writing style appropriate to the nature of the communication


* Ability to speak in a compelling manner with correct grammar, word usage, tone, and inflection


* Ability to read, interpret and apply advanced written materials for practical business purposes (e.g., laws, regulations and policies).
* Competency in using technology as a strategic business solution as demonstrated by:


* Ability to develop and implement strategies to integrate technology into multiple business areas


* Proficient use of MS Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint


* Successful experience as a teleworker (remote worker)


* Telework\\-ready home environment (furniture, privacy, high\\-speed Internet connection, reliable WiFi)


High school diploma/GED with five (5\\) years of job\\-related experience in planning analysis, analyzing data, designing surveys, preparing and writing reports of findings or work related to the area of assignment; or two (2\\) years of experience required at the lower level Research Analyst 2 (EDP041\\) or position equivalent.

title: Web Developer
description:
ABOUT THIS POSITION
We are looking for a skilled web developer who is a highly organized, dynamic team player to support cutting\\-edge growth\\-marketing strategies through web development.  

  

This role will be responsible for the coding, layout, and functionality of our WordPress website. They will work collaboratively with key stakeholders, including members from Performance Marketing, Brand Marketing, and IT teams, to ensure a well\\-performing, visually stunning, and innovative website with exceptional user experience. Additionally, they will identify areas for optimization with a focus on conversion rate optimization (CRO) while ensuring compliance with web regulations. Our ideal candidate is a strategic, results\\-driven professional with extensive technical expertise who can work independently or with a team. They should have exceptional project management skills, the ability to juggle multiple priorities, and meticulous attention to detail to maintain brand consistency. The right candidate is proactive, solution\\-oriented, and proficient with JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and modern front\\-end frameworks.
WHAT YOU'LL DO* Develop and optimize the Waystar WordPress website and all subdomains, ensuring high performance, security, and modern design
* Work closely with the Brand Marketing team’s designers and content writers to ensure all web assets align with Waystar’s brand identity, messaging, and visual guidelines
* Maintain and manage WordPress plugins as well as other applications that support our overall web experience
* Ensure compliance with web regulations, including GDPR, CCPA, ADA accessibility, and evolving cookie policies, by implementing necessary updates and best practices
* Collaborate with Waystar’s IT team to ensure security, uptime, and adherence to internal compliance policies
* Expand and scale our website, including creating and updating landing pages, supporting A/B testing efforts, conducting QA, and optimizing conversion rates and SEO
* Develop and maintain Marketo landing pages, including editing core templates and creating new pages for events, campaigns, and content
* Manage Google Tag Manager and Google Analytics, setting up tracking pixels, custom events, and performance monitoring tools
* Implement modern, visually polished, and highly interactive user interfaces that enhance Waystar’s brand perception and user experience
* Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams to ensure the front\\-end is optimized for accessibility, usability, and performance
* Ensure all web assets are meticulously aligned with brand standards, design principles, and content guidelines
* Stay informed on industry trends and best practices to ensure Waystar’s web presence remains cutting\\-edge
* Develop reusable front\\-end components, libraries, and tools, including calculators, quizzes, and interactive elements
* Utilize version control systems to manage code repositories, ensure team collaboration, and maintain clean development workflows


WHAT YOU'LL NEED* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology, web development, or a related field (Candidates with marketing or communications backgrounds and strong technical experience will also be considered.)
* 2\\-4 years of web development experience, including a track record of effectively delivering projects in a fast\\-moving environment
* Strong communication abilities; written and verbal
* Ability to take initiative and prioritize tasks with excellent time\\-management and organizational skills
* Meticulous attention to detail and a strong eye for design, user experience, and brand consistency
* Experience in planning, developing, and maintaining websites with a focus on security, compliance, and performance
* Extensive knowledge of web applications, programming languages, and web services, including API, CSS, CSS3, cross\\-browser compatibility, HTML, HTML5, JavaScript, jQuery, PHP, security principles, REST, SOAP, and web user interface design
* Proficiency in WordPress, Marketo, and modern front\\-end tools such as Sketch or Adobe XD
* Experience with Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and tracking implementation


BONUS POINTS* Experience with Salesforce
* Marketo email template coding
* Experience with database management tools
* Award\\-winning work featured on Webby, Awwwards, or Site of the Day


ABOUT WAYSTAR
Through a smart platform and better experience, Waystar helps providers simplify healthcare payments and yield powerful results throughout the complete revenue cycle.
Waystar’s healthcare payments platform combines innovative, cloud\\-based technology, robust data, and unparalleled client support to streamline workflows and improve financials so providers can focus on what matters most: their patients and communities. Waystar is trusted by 1M\\+ providers, 1K\\+ hospitals and health systems, and is connected to over 5K commercial and Medicaid/Medicare payers. We are deeply committed to living out our organizational values: honesty; kindness; passion; curiosity; fanatical focus; best work, always; making it happen; and joyful, optimistic \\& fun.
Waystar products have won multiple Best in KLAS® or Category Leader awards since 2010 and earned multiple \\#1 rankings from Black Book™ surveys since 2012\\. The Waystar platform supports more than 500,000 providers, 1,000 health systems and hospitals, and 5,000 payers and health plans. For more information, visit waystar.com or follow @Waystar on Twitter.
WAYSTAR PERKS* Competitive total rewards (base salary \\+ bonus, if applicable)
* Customizable benefits package (3 medical plans with Health Saving Account company match)
* Generous paid time off starting at 3 weeks \\+ 13 paid holidays including 2 personal floating holidays
* Paid parental leave (including maternity \\+ paternity leave)
* Education assistance opportunities and free LinkedIn Learning access
* Free mental health and family planning programs, including adoption assistance and fertility support
* 401(K) program with company match
* Pet insurance
* Employee resource groups


Waystar is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We celebrate, value, and support diversity and inclusion. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, marital status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.
This applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

title: Data Scientist
description:
**Job Title: Data Scientist**  
**Location: Atlanta, GA (onsite)**

**Job Description:**  
Position Overview: We are looking for a highly experienced Data Scientist (DS) who thrives on solving complex problems through cutting\\-edge machine learning algorithms and advanced statistical techniques. This role requires a deep technical skillset and the ability to design, build, and deploy predictive models to drive business decisions and innovation.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Develop and implement advanced data science models, including clustering, segmentation, random forest, gradient boosting (e.g., XGBoost), ensemble techniques, and constrained optimization methods.
* Explore additional approaches such as neural networks, support vector machines, and Bayesian methods to address diverse business challenges.
* Design and execute matched\\-pair analyses, predictive analytics, and other statistical approaches to address business challenges.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to identify use cases for advanced modeling and provide data science\\-driven solutions.
* Engineer features and preprocess data to optimize model performance and interpretability.
* Work with large datasets from diverse sources, ensuring data quality and consistency.
* Perform model evaluation, tuning, and validation using appropriate techniques and metrics.
* Deploy machine learning models into production environments, ensuring scalability and reliability.
* Mentor and collaborate with team members to share knowledge and best practices.
* Stay current on advancements in data science, tools, and methodologies to bring innovation to the team.

title: Developer Support Engineer
description:
At JFrog, we're reinventing DevOps to help the world's greatest companies innovate \\- and we want you along for the ride. This is a special place with a unique combination of brilliance, spirit and just all\\-around great people. Here, if you're willing to do more, your career can take off. And since software plays a central role in everyone's lives, you'll be part of an important mission. Thousands of customers, including 75% of the Fortune 100, trust JFrog to manage, accelerate, and secure their software delivery from code to production \\- a concept we call "liquid software." Wouldn't it be amazing if you could join us in our journey?



We are looking for top\\-notch **Developer Support Engineers**, to be partners rather than just employees and be the technical focal point for JFrog customers. Besides a wild ride and a lot of learning, we'll leap your career forward!


#### **As a Developer Support Engineer in JFrog you will...**


* Troubleshoot and Investigate complex customer's CI/CD scenarios and provide innovative solutions for their requirements

* Set up JFrog applications and 3rd party products in various development environments

* Integrate and collaborate with JFrog's R\\&D, QA, Release and Sales teams

#### **To be a Developer Support Engineer in JFrog you need…**

**WHAT JFROG CAN OFFER…**


* At JFrog, base salary is only one component of our compensation package.
* This position has a base salary range between $90,000 to $95,000\\. Base salary will be based on your skills, qualifications, experience and location.
* JFrog embraces hybrid work: 3 days in office / 2 days remote.

JFrog is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. title: Product Manager Senior - Finance Data
description:
We use technology to solve problems in spaces, light, and more things to come… for our customers, our communities, and our planet.  

  

Acuity Brands, Inc. (NYSE: AYI) is a market\\-leading industrial technology company. We use technology to solve problems in spaces, light, and more things to come. Through our two business segments, Acuity Brands Lighting and Lighting Controls (ABL) and the Intelligent Spaces Group (ISG), we design, manufacture, and bring to market products and services that make a valuable difference in people’s lives.  

  

We are positioned at the intersection of sustainability and technology. Our businesses develop technology that helps save our customers energy and reduce their carbon emissions. We achieve growth through the development of innovative new products and services, including lighting, lighting controls, building management solutions, and location\\-aware applications.

**Job Summary**
---------------

  

Are you passionate about transforming financial data into actionable insights? Do you thrive on building robust data strategies that enhance operational efficiency and drive decision\\-making? Join Acuity Brands as a Senior Product Manager and spearhead our Master Data and Reporting strategy within the finance domain. You’ll play a critical role in defining how we manage and govern financial data across the organization, ensuring alignment with business needs and driving innovation through analytics and reporting.

  

We are seeking a strategic and hands\\-on leader to define and execute our finance data roadmap. This role will oversee the development of the finance domain model within our data lake and reporting tools, prioritize reporting needs, and work closely with cross\\-functional teams to ensure data accuracy and consistency. If you have a strong background in finance data management, data analytics, and an appetite for creating impactful solutions, this could be the perfect opportunity for you to help us shape the future of our financial systems.

**Key Tasks \\& Responsibilities**
---------------------------------

* **Finance Data Strategy:** Develop and lead the Master Data strategy for the finance domain, ensuring that data governance, consistency, and integrity are maintained across all financial systems.
* **Data Model Development:** Own the build\\-out of the finance domain model, ensuring it supports the organization’s reporting and analytics needs while being scalable and adaptable to future growth.
* **Reporting \\& Analytics Leadership:** Drive the reporting and analytics strategy by prioritizing and delivering on reporting needs. Ensure that financial data is accessible, accurate, and actionable for key stakeholders across the business.
* **Cross\\-Functional Collaboration:** Collaborate with finance, technology, and operations teams to align the finance data roadmap with broader organizational objectives. Facilitate stakeholder meetings to gather insights and refine data solutions.
* **Data Governance \\& Compliance:** Ensure that all finance data adheres to governance frameworks and compliance requirements. Develop and implement processes for managing data changes and maintaining accuracy.
* **Performance Tracking:** Establish and maintain key metrics (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of financial data management. Use data\\-driven insights to guide continuous improvements.
* **Change Management:** Lead change management initiatives to promote the adoption of new data processes, providing training and support to ensure smooth transitions.
* **Risk Management:** Identify potential risks associated with data management and reporting changes. Develop strategies to mitigate risks while ensuring business continuity.
* **Thought Leadership:** Serve as a subject matter expert in finance data management, staying up\\-to\\-date with industry trends and innovations to drive improvements and best practices.
**To Be Successful in This Role**
---------------------------------

  

Success in this role requires a deep understanding of finance data management, a strategic mindset, and the ability to drive large\\-scale data initiatives.

* **Holistic Approach:** Ability to view and understand the interconnectedness of finance, operations, and technology within the organization, ensuring data strategies align with business goals.
* **Data\\-Centric Focus:** Passion for leveraging data to drive decision\\-making, improve financial accuracy, and deliver actionable insights.
* **Proactive Problem Solving:** Capability to dive into complex data challenges, asking critical questions and developing solutions that are both strategic and operationally efficient.
* **Strategic Execution:** Strong capability to develop and manage the product roadmap for finance data and reporting, balancing short\\-term needs with long\\-term objectives.
* **Collaborative Leadership:** Proven experience working in a cross\\-functional environment, with the ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders at all levels.
* **Resilience \\& Adaptability:** Comfortable navigating ambiguity and adapting to changing business needs, viewing each challenge as an opportunity for innovation.
**Skills and Minimum Experience Required**
------------------------------------------

  

* Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Information Systems, Data Management, or a related field.
* 5\\+ years of experience in finance data management, analytics, and reporting.
* Strong understanding of financial systems, ERP integrations, and master data management.
* Proven ability to manage large\\-scale data projects involving multiple stakeholders and system integrations.
* Effective communication skills with the ability to present complex data concepts to non\\-technical stakeholders.
**Preferred Skills and Experience**
-----------------------------------

  

* Advanced degree in Finance, Data Science, or related field.
* Experience with cloud\\-based data lakes, such as Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud.
* Prior experience implementing a finance data domain model across multiple financial systems/ERPs.
* Prior experience implementing a finance master data solution with multiple downstream integrations.

  

\\#LI\\-EG1

**Travel Requirements**
-----------------------

* 1\\-20%

We value diversity and are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regards to race, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, ethnicity or national origin, disability, pregnancy, religion, covered veteran status, protected genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

If you have difficulty using our online system due to a disability and need an accommodation, you may contact us at (770\\) 922\\-9000\\. Acuity Brands will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.

  

Acuity Brands will consider any candidate for whom an Agency has submitted an unsolicited resume to have been referred by the Agency free of any charges or fees. This includes any Agency that is an approved/engaged vendor, but does not have the appropriate approvals to be engaged on a search.

**Job Title:** Firmware / Software Engineering Manager

At IPA, we believe in valuing our employees' well\\-being and providing comprehensive benefits that support both their personal and professional lives. Enjoy paid holidays \\& flexible time off, comprehensive healthcare including Telemedicine, HSA \\& FSA options, and Company\\-paid life and disability insurance. Plan for the future with a 401k match and Employee Stock Purchase program.

**Job Summary:**

Reporting directly to the Vice President of Engineering and Product Development, the Firmware/Software Manager leads the development and delivery of critical firmware and software solutions for our cutting\\-edge products. This role oversees the entire development lifecycle, ensuring high\\-quality, optimized, and scalable designs that meet business and technical objectives. As a leader\\-doer, this position requires a balance of hands\\-on technical execution and strategic leadership to drive innovation, efficiency, and excellence.

**Leadership \\& Team Management:**

* Lead, mentor, and manage software, firmware, and DevOps engineers.

**Quality Assurance \\& Compliance:**

* Maintain accurate records throughout development to comply with company and government regulations.
* Establish KPIs to measure and optimize quality and efficiency.

**Innovation \\& Problem\\-Solving:**

* Stay updated on emerging technologies to drive innovation.
* Collaborate with technical experts and team members to solve complex technical problems.
* Support department and company objectives by recommending policy and procedural improvements.

**Administrative \\& Compliance Responsibilities:**

* Provide estimates for project planning and resource allocation.
* Attend meetings and training sessions as required.
* Complete required reports and records accurately and promptly.
* Adhere to established security safeguards, procedures, and company policies.

**Other Duties:**

* Perform other engineering duties as assigned to support the Engineering and Product Development functions.

**Qualifications:**

**Education and Experience Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
* 7\\+ years of experience in software/firmware development and DevOps, including 3\\+ years in leadership.

**Skills \\& Abilites:**

* Professional experience with switches, solenoids, motors, and other electromechanical components.
* Knowledge of serial communication protocols (RS232, RS485, CAN, SPI), USB communications, TCP/IP, and SQL databases.
* Experience with PCB layout and design.
* Proficiency in programming languages such as C, C\\+\\+, Python, Java, or Go.
* Strong leadership, problem\\-solving, and communication skills.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities in a fast\\-paced environment.
* Excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills.
* Strong understanding of firmware development and embedded systems.
* Hands\\-on expertise with DevOps tools like Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, Ansible, and Jenkins.
* Strong knowledge of cloud platforms (Azure) and infrastructure as code.
* Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies.
* Knowledge of cybersecurity best practices.
* Experience with microcontrollers and their programming (Atmel, ARM microprocessors, SBCs, and Linux distributions).
* Application development lifecycle, code reviews, software testing, packaging/deployment, and malfunction RCA.
* Proficient in C/C\\+\\+ programming, Linux, microcontroller firmware, and VMWare/virtual machines.
* Skilled in the use of electronic test equipment, e.g., multi\\-meter and oscilloscope.

**About Us:**

IPA is a global leader in innovative linen and specialty uniform distribution solutions. Our cutting\\-edge software and hardware empower you to efficiently manage distribution, enhance staff satisfaction, reduce infection risks, and lower costs. Proudly made in the U.S.A, our solutions are trusted by over 1,000\\+ hospitals worldwide. Since our inception in 1995, IPA has evolved into the industry frontrunner, serving more than 1 million healthcare professionals daily. From community hospitals to top academic hospitals, including 18 of the 20 hospitals on the U.S. News and World Report Best Hospitals Honor Roll 2023\\-2024, our technology sets the standard for excellence.

For more about life at IPA visit

https://www.thinkipa.com/careers

IPA is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

**COVID\\-19 considerations:**

IPA is mandating that all of our employees must have the COVID vaccine. To be considered for this position, you must be fully vaccinated before the start of employment. Exemptions and accommodations will be made for legitimate religious or medical reasons.

title: Software Engineer Sr
description:
Every day, Global Payments makes it possible for millions of people to move money between buyers and sellers using our payments solutions for credit, debit, prepaid and merchant services. Our worldwide team helps over 3 million companies, more than 1,300 financial institutions and over 600 million cardholders grow with confidence and achieve amazing results. We are driven by our passion for success and we are proud to deliver best\\-in\\-class payment technology and software solutions. Join our dynamic team and make your mark on the payments technology landscape of tomorrow.


**Summary of This Role**
------------------------


Works throughout the software development life cycle and performs in a utility capacity to create, design, code, debug, maintain, test, implement and validate applications with a broad understanding of a variety of Mainframe languages and architectures. Analyzes existing applications or formulate logic for new applications, procedures, flowcharting, coding and debugging programs. Maintains and utilizes application and programming documents in the development of code. Recommends changes in development, maintenance and system standards. Creates appropriate deliverables and develops application implementation plans throughout the life cycle in a flexible development environment.

**What Part Will You Play?**
----------------------------

* Provide expert\\-level support for mainframe applications, including troubleshooting, problem resolution, and performance tuning.
* Develop, enhance, and maintain mainframe applications using COBOL, Assembler, VSAM, JCL, and REXX.
* Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams to analyze requirements, design solutions, and implement changes.
* Manage and control software migrations using Endevor or similar tools.
* Create and maintain comprehensive technical documentation, including flowcharts and diagrams.
* Mentor and train team members, particularly in z/OS Assembler language.

* Be a strong advocate for the development team’s priorities and challenge and will push back on scope\\-creep and negotiate timelines with the product owner
* Provides support to leadership for the design, development and enforcement of business / infrastructure application standards to include associated controls, procedures and monitoring to ensure compliance and accuracy of data. Applies a full understanding of procedures, methodology and application standards to include Payment Card Industry (PCI) security compliance.

**What Are We Looking For in This Role?**
-----------------------------------------

### **Minimum Qualifications**

* BS in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business / Management Information Systems or related field
* Typically minimum of 4 years \\- Professional Experience In Coding, Designing, Developing And Analyzing Data. Typically has an advanced knowledge and use of one or more front / back end languages / technologies and a moderate understanding of the other corresponding end language / technology from the following but not limited to; two or more modern programming languages used in the enterprise, experience working with various APIs, external Services, experience with both relational and NoSQL Databases.

### **Preferred Qualifications**

* BS in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business / Management Information Systems or related field
* 6\\+ years professional Experience In Coding, Designing, Developing, Application support And Analyzing Data and experience with IBM Rational Tools

**What Are Our Desired Skills and Capabilities?**
-------------------------------------------------

* Skills / Knowledge \\- A seasoned, experienced professional with a full understanding of area of specialization; resolves a wide range of issues in creative ways. This job is the fully qualified, career\\-oriented, journey\\-level position.
* Job Complexity \\- Works on problems of diverse scope where analysis of data requires evaluation of identifiable factors. Demonstrates good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions. Networks with senior internal and external personnel in own area of expertise.
* Supervision \\- Normally receives little instruction on day\\-to\\-day work, general instructions on new assignments.


Cobol, IMS, \\& DB2 (Required): Java (Desired)

* Job Complexity \\- Works on complex issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in\\-depth evaluation of variable factors. Exercises judgment in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. Networks with key contacts outside own area of expertise.
* Supervision \\- Determines methods and procedures on new assignments and may coordinate activities of other personnel (Team Lead).
* IBM Mainframe System \\- COBOL, JCL, CICS, SQL, z/OS, DB2, IMS, Assembler, VSAM, XML, TSO/ISPF, MQ

=============================

**What You Will Do in This Role** **:**

* Design and develop scalable, high\\-performance software solutions for multi\\-tenant, cloud\\-based warehouse optimization systems powered by big data and AI.
* Write clean, maintainable, and high\\-quality code, ensuring alignment to industry best practices.
* Lead full\\-stack development, contributing to both front\\-end and back\\-end components using frameworks such as: Lit, Vue, React, Angular and services including REST, GraphQL and WebSockets.
* Optimize database performance, working with both SQL and NoSQL databases, and implement big data technologies for real\\-time analytics.

* Collaborate cross\\-functionally with UX designers, product managers, and engineering teams to deliver seamless and impactful user experiences.

* Bachelor's degree in engineering or similar field

title: Data Scientist Associate
description:
Overview:

This position sits within our Product Development division, which develops, tests, and improves our software solutions in an innovative and collaborative environment. **The Opportunity**

  

As Data Scientist Associate, you will work in a team to expand the analytics capabilities of the company by identifying business trends and solve complex problems. You will interpret results from petabytes of data using a variety of techniques, ranging from simple data aggregation via statistical analysis to complex data mining. You will also engage in developing Machine Learning and AI solutions to complicated problems on the leading edge of construction planning technology. You will have the opportunity to design, develop and implement best\\-in\\-class solutions for our organization and our clients.
Responsibilities:
**What You’ll Be Doing**  

* Use data analysis combined with economic and business knowledge to make recommendations on the business direction to various stakeholders within the company.
* Define and develop analytical, statistical and machine learning algorithms for advanced analysis and prediction
* Work with Python and other technologies to do rapid design, prototyping, analysis, simulation, and experimentation.
* Build massively scalable solutions and predictive models
* Collaborate across the organization to develop curated training data sets for Machine Learning
* This job description in no way implies that the duties listed here are the only ones that team members can be required to perform


Qualifications:
**What You Bring to the Team**

  

* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Econometrics, Computer Science, or related quantitative discipline
* Creative problem\\-solver who is passionate about digging into complex problems and devising new approaches to reach results.
* Strong communication skills and experience distilling and presenting complex quantitative analysis into action\\-oriented recommendations.
* Understanding of applied mathematics, statistics, and economics
* Experience with a range of data science techniques including computer vision, NLP, and network analysis
* Familiarity with Tensorflow or Pytorch

 **Physical Demands and Work Environment:**  

* The physical activities of this position include frequent sitting, telephone communication, working on a computer for extended periods of time. Visual acuity is required to perform activities close to the eyes.
* This position is considered Hybrid. Team members are expected to have an established workspace.
* Ability to work hybrid in Norcross, GA area

  

**E\\-Verify Statement**  

ConstructConnect utilizes the E\\-Verify program with every potential new hire. This makes it possible for us to make certain that every employee who works for ConstructConnect is eligible to work in the United States. To learn more about E\\-Verify you can call 1\\-800\\-255\\-7688 or visit their website. E\\-Verify® is a registered trademark of the United States Department of Homeland Security.  

Privacy Notice

title: Mainframe Software Engineer II or Senior
description:
Every day, Global Payments makes it possible for millions of people to move money between buyers and sellers using our payments solutions for credit, debit, prepaid and merchant services. Our worldwide team helps over 3 million companies, more than 1,300 financial institutions and over 600 million cardholders grow with confidence and achieve amazing results. We are driven by our passion for success and we are proud to deliver best\\-in\\-class payment technology and software solutions. Join our dynamic team and make your mark on the payments technology landscape of tomorrow.


**Position is open to work in Alpharetta, GA or Columbus, GA Location. And Remote work in the Atlanta area only. Candidates must live locally to the area. Candidates in Columbus will work a Hybrid work model of 3 days in office.**

**The position is not open to Sponsorship now or anytime in the future.**

**On a day to day basis you will:**

* Work within an agile scrum team to include a ScrumMaster, Product Owner, business analyst, test analysts, application developers and client counterparts to design and deliver new products or capabilities in an iterative, continuous fashion
* Develop detailed user stories, acceptance criteria, screen mock\\-ups, flow diagrams, etc. outlining the solution to be implemented
* Be accountable for assisting in the gathering and verification of non\\-functional requirements, review of architectures and designs, adherence to standards, and developing and implementing strategies for validating that the target requirements have been adequately addressed
* Be an active participant in all agile scrum ceremonies
* Be responsible for maintaining project and system documentation
* Be a strong advocate for the development team’s priorities and challenge and will push back on scope\\-creep and negotiate timelines with the product owner

**You would be a particularly good fit if you:**

* Are able to collaborate openly within a mixed team of developers, analysts and product owners
* Have the ability to analyze a problem, organize thoughts and recommend approaches
* Are a creative thinker, comfortable pushing the boundaries of standard industry practices
* Are a self\\-starter looking for responsibility and a place you can make an impact
* Like to innovate and make things around you better
* Are experienced in Agile/Scrum methodology, and the development of associated project artifacts (i.e., user stories, acceptance criteria).

**Job Specific Duties \\& Responsibilities:**

* Programmer duties and responsibilities as listed in job description, along with contributing to/ participating in and supporting Agile practices.
* Agile team of 5\\-7 people comprised of Business, Technical, and Testing team members, sitting in close proximity to each other, finding a balance between individual and team work. Aside from learning TSYS and TS2, which is ongoing for one’s entire time at TSYS, truly understanding and supporting what Agile means and how it drives the majority of what we do and how we do them.
* Participate in all phases of the software development life cycle utilizing Agile Scrum methodology in the creation of new software products.
* Design, create, and deliver moderately complex program specifications for code development and support on multiple projects/issues with a wide understanding of the application / database to better align interactions and technologies.
* Provide broad and in\\-depth knowledge of analysis, modification, and development of complex code/unit testing in order to develop concise application documentation.
* Advise leadership on the design, development and enforcement of business / infrastructure application standards to include associated controls, procedures and monitoring to ensure compliance and accuracy of data.
* Perform and advise on testing, validation requirements, and corrective measures for complex code deficiencies and provides systemic proposals

**Job Specific Skills \\& Competencies**

* Are able to collaborate openly within a mixed team of developers, analysts and product owners
* Have the ability to analyze a problem, organize thoughts and recommend approaches
* Are a creative thinker, comfortable pushing the boundaries of standard industry practices
* Are a self\\-starter looking for responsibility and a place you can make an impact
* Like to innovate and make things around you better
* Are experienced in Agile/Scrum methodology, and the development of associated project artifacts (i.e., user stories, acceptance criteria).

**Typical Day in the Life of the Role**

* Work within an agile scrum team to include a ScrumMaster, Product Owner, business analyst, test analysts, application developers and client counterparts to design and deliver new products or capabilities in an iterative, continuous fashion
* Develop detailed user stories, acceptance criteria, screen mock\\-ups, flow diagrams, etc. outlining the solution to be implemented
* Be accountable for assisting in the gathering and verification of non\\-functional requirements, review of architectures and designs, adherence to standards, and developing and implementing strategies for validating that the target requirements have been adequately addressed
* Be an active participant in all agile scrum ceremonies
* Be responsible for maintaining project and system documentation
* Be a strong advocate for the development team’s priorities and challenge and will push back on scope\\-creep and negotiate timelines with the product owner

**Job Specific Skills Required/Desired:**


Cobol, IMS, \\& DB2 (Required): Java (Desired)


There will be quarterly travel to visit client site in the Eastern Time Zone for 2\\-3 days

**Minimum Qualifications**

* Bachelor's Degree
* Relevant Experience or Degree in: Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Business or related field
* Typically Minimum 2\\+ Years Relevant Exp
* Four\\-year college degree and 2\\+ years professional experience, or a high school diploma with 4\\+ years professional experience in coding, designing, developing and analyzing data

 **Preferred Qualifications**

* Typically Minimum 2\\+ Years Relevant Exp
* IBM Rational Tools a plus

**What Are Our Desired Skills and Capabilities?**
-------------------------------------------------

* Skills / Knowledge \\- Having wide\\-ranging experience, uses professional concepts and company objectives to resolve complex issues in creative and effective ways. Some barriers to entry exist at this level (e.g., dept./peer review).
* Job Complexity \\- Works on complex issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in\\-depth evaluation of variable factors. Exercises judgment in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. Networks with key contacts outside own area of expertise.

title: Esri ArcGIS Developer II
description:
Under broad supervision, designs, codes, tests, modifies and debugs computer applications utilizing Esri ArcGIS.

Our client is seeking a technical GIS developer for configuring and developing custom Esri ArcGIS Enterprise 10x, 11x (Javascript API, Experience Builder, ArcGIS Portal/Online/Hub, Field Maps) applications. Applications are deployed within SharePoint web sites. Custom GIS solutions will be integrated within .NET based applications, client databases (Oracle/Oracle Exadata, SQL Server), data warehouse (Oracle Exadata), and enterprise reporting (Oracle Business Intelligence Enterprise Edition (OBIEE), Data Visualizer, or Power BI). The candidate will have application programming/development, implementation, and support experience.

Under broad supervision, the candidate will design, code, test, modify, and debugs computer software and applications utilizing Esri ArcGIS. The candidate will research and analyze program or systems problems, provides resolutions, and complete system documentation. The candidate will translate business requirements/user stories into development activities in secure, commented, and maintainable code.

The candidate will be working in the Enterprise GIS Team of the Office of IT Applications. The candidate will work with supporting IT team members (database, network, server, etc.) and interact with management, architects, developers, and business units. The candidate will follow internal SLDC, standards/guidelines, and accepted best practices for developing solutions.

The Enterprise GIS team is composed of 2 ArcGIS developers, 2 System Administrators, a data manager, and team leader. The team supports over 180 ArcGIS Desktop users and approximately 60,000 annual ArcGIS Server web visits. Applications support GIS portal, feature mapping, project planning, emergency operations, permitting, safety, and traffic records.

The team develops enterprise GIS services, applications, and databases. The team coordinates with client, server, network, and database/data warehouse personnel to support and develop the underlying IT solutions.

NOTE: While the intent may be a long\\-term tenure, this position is subject to annual budget restrictions. The initial contract is through the end of this fiscal year and is anticipated to be renewed July 1, 2025\\.

**Responsibilities:**

* Develops customized web applications, webservices, mobile, and enterprise solutions
* Develops geoprocessing and GIS web services
* Develops GIS web editing/mapping applications
* Conducts performance, unit, system, integration, and quality assurance testing of applications
* Maintains existing applications/services
* Upgrades and migrates existing applications/services to current version/systems architecture
* Provides end user support and creates support documentation
* Works closely with other developers and architects
* Estimates work effort and proposes/designs development solutions

**Work Terms and Conditions:**

* 8 Hour workdays on a fixed schedule (i.e. not a flex\\-schedule), starting no earlier than 7:00AM Eastern Time, starting no later than 9:00AM Eastern Time, Monday \\- Friday, 40 hours per week
* Client has NOT specified a number of days onsite vs remote. However, local candidates (i.e. able to come in office) will be preferred over an out of state candidates (i.e. remote worker). Client prefers candidates who can demonstrate they have the capability to work a hybrid work schedule which is a combination of remote and in\\-office work. Candidate capacity (i.e. days they could come into the office) to work a hybrid work schedule will be discussed during interviews.
* The consultant will follow all applicable client policies, procedures, standards, guidelines, and accepted best practices.
* The position end date is set for the end of the Fiscal Year. The client may exercise the option to renew contracts in one\\-year increments. Several successful consultants have continued working for several years with contract extensions. However, the client is under no obligation to extend contracts and may terminate employment at any time.
* When teleworking or working remotely, consultant must have suitable internet connection and environment to comply with client's telework policies.
* Client will reimburse authorized travel expense lodging and meals. Client will reimburse authorized travel use of a personal vehicle. Any travel expenses to start work or relocate to Georgia or will NOT be reimbursed.
* The Client has 13 holidays, which consultants are not allowed to work nor make up any time for those holiday weeks without management's approval.
* Candidate is not to take extended leave during their first year of service (e.g. greater than 1 week).
* Consultant must have cell phone which can be used for business calls.
* Client does not provide free parking. All routine commuting expenses are the responsibility of the consultant.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $50\\.17 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Python Scripting: 4 years (Required)
* PL/SQL: 4 years (Required)
* JavaScript API: 3 years (Preferred)
* HTML: 1 year (Required)
* ArcGIS: 3 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Atlanta, GA 30308 (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Atlanta, GA 30308

title: AI Technical Advisor
description:
**Requisition ID:** **419484**  

**Work Area:** **Sales**  

**Expected Travel:** **0 \\- 40%**  

**Career Status:** **Professional**  

**Employment Type:** **Regular Full Time**  

**Career Level:** **T3**  

**Hiring Manager:** **Jared Coyle**  

**Recruiter Name:** **Timothy Moore**  

**Additional Locations:**

  

Required.
The AI Technical Solution Advisor role focuses on the technology aspects of SAP’s Business AI, supporting the sales organization by providing deep technology solution and architectural expertise, with an additional focus on AI use cases.

 ***Current openings within:***


SAP’s Business Technology Platform – HR –Finance – Procurement \\- Supply Chain.

 **What you'll do:**


The Customer Advisory AI Technical Solution Advisor works closely with SAP’s sales organization and the partner ecosystem to define account strategy as it relates to Artificial Intelligence. AI SAs are responsible for bridging the gap between the customer’s business strategy and relevant Business AI technologies. They are trusted advisors for the customer and SAP sales team to map AI technology and architecture to a customer’s Business AI roadmap.


As an AI Solution Advisor, you will focus on the following key areas:

**Providing Technological Guidance in Business AI**

* Provide technical guidance for sales cycles being carried out within a geographic market unit in North America
* Support the AI architectural roadmap building in sales cycles end\\-to\\-end for marquee accounts
* Clarify detailed questions from customers around AI technology, and topics like user authorizations and functional scope of pre\\-built AI use cases
* Triage incoming requests from customers and sales teams around Business AI technology
* Help to facilitate bi\\-weekly office hours with regional sales teams as the technical subject matter expert

 **Creating an SAP AI Vision for the Customer to build Pipeline**

* Support building customer demand through presentations of Business AI technology
* Understand customer’s technical architecture and business process to create target architectures
* Understand customer’s current enterprise landscape and future needs
* Drive the positioning of standard AI approaches leveraging SAP Business AI
* Engage in pipeline\\-building activities such as regional AI community events with technology audiences

 **Building Key Business AI Deliverables to drive Sales Results**

* Facilitation and execution of AI Discovery Workshops with technical audiences
* Drive Business AI architecture and capability mapping to solution design
* Ensure IT feasibility of the Business AI mapping to SAP solution architecture.
* Support customer cloud transformation roadmap definition

 **Being a Business AI Advisor for the Customer to create Lifetime Value**

* Support customer workshops and meetings to develop relationships with key technology leaders at the customer
* Support updating AI roadmaps \\& solution maps in your particular domain of functional focus with the customer
* Drive solution expansion by highlighting value \\& linkages to the broader SAP Portfolio
* Support the end\\-to\\-end lifecycle of solution activation and consumption

 **What you bring:**

* A deep technological understanding of AI concepts (Retrieval Augmented Generation, Knowledge Graphs, Vector Databases, LLMs, SLMs, etc.)
* A willingness to learn all the relevant functional, embedded AI use cases provided in a particular functional area of SAP’s portfolio (e.g. Supply Chain, Human Capital, Finance, etc.)
* Experience working with traditional narrow AI (e.g. ML projects, predictive analysis, forecasting, etc.)
* Hands\\-on experience running data science projects and designing architectures for advanced analytics
* Experience acting as the trusted technology advisor of an enterprise software organization to a customer
* Demonstrated experience of driving tangible outcomes in enterprise customer software sales
* Fluency in English; any other language is an asset.
* Education: Bachelor's degree (or equivalent) required

 **Meet your team:**


At the core of our mission, the AI Advisor team is dedicated to guiding SAP’s sales teams, and SAP’s customer through their Business AI transformation journey. Our experts work collaboratively to deliver tailored, consistent value to every customer, ensuring they achieve the best results from their cloud investments.


We are passionate about enhancing the end\\-to\\-end customer experience. By focusing on improving the adoption and consumption of SAP’s products and services, we help customers unlock the full potential of their technology solutions.


By speaking our customers' language, we build stronger foundations of trust and credibility. This allows us to engage with them in more meaningful ways, addressing industry\\-specific needs, challenges, and opportunities. The better we understand our customers, the easier it becomes to foster lasting relationships that drive real business transformation.


Whether helping customers overcome obstacles or identifying new growth avenues, the AI Advisor team is committed to delivering value every step of the way.

 **Candidate(s) will be required to work 3 days a week in office/client site as per our Pledge to Flex return to office policy**

 **SAP is not offering relocation benefits for this role at this time.**

**SAP is not offering visa sponsorship for this role at this time**.

**Bring out your best**


SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end\\-to\\-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management.
