title: .NET Cloud Architect
description:
### About CapTech Consulting:



  

  


 CapTech is an award\\-winning consulting firm that collaborates with clients to achieve what’s possible through the power of technology. At CapTech, we’re passionate about the work we do and the results we achieve for our clients. From the outset, our founders shared a collective passion to create a consultancy centered on strong relationships that would stand the test of time. Today we work alongside clients that include Fortune 100 companies, mid\\-sized enterprises, and government agencies, a list that spans across the country
 


 Job Description
   

  


 Job Description
 



 Cloud Architects at CapTech are called upon to perform various responsibilities within CapTech’s Systems Integration practice area, usually in the context of a technology assessment, strategy formation, or a development project performed for a particular client. They often lead a team of developers and collaborate with experienced project managers, analysts, designers, and clients to architect and deliver vital internal and customer facing systems in partnership with a variety of Fortune 500 clients. Typically, CapTech Architects have a broad understanding of many tools, technologies, and products, with some specialization in a few areas. Over time these specialties may change due to industry transformation or a changing client profile, and as such, our architects have the opportunity to get hands\\-on experience with the latest technologies while working with passionate CapTechers solving complex problems across numerous industries.
 



 Specific responsibilities for the Cloud Architect position include:
 


* Position yourself as a trusted advisor to CapTech clients.
* Oversee and set the technical direction of client projects, collaborating directly with client staff to define and adhere to architectural standards.
* Lead internal teams and act as a Service Offering liaison
* Design, implement, integrate, and support Cloud solutions
* Work closely with clients, subject matter experts and the CapTech team to understand requirements, establish priorities and project scope, and manage expectations and project delivery
* Define the technical and solution architecture for phased software development
* Provide hands\\-on technical direction to other developers to review code and resolve issues
* Create documents that specify strategy, assessment, or design in a way that delivers obvious value to the client and is understandable by any stakeholder
* Articulate architectural differences between solution methods and the challenges and approaches to integrating solutions built on different platforms, including a working knowledge of architectural frameworks that may be used by our clients.
* Apply detailed knowledge of organizational procedures to make independent decisions and serve as a credible resource for the client’s senior management team
* Collaborate with CapTech business development team members during sales efforts to demonstrate CapTech’s technical capabilities, create a vision for a solution that CapTech can build, and produce estimates and work plans



  
 



  
 


 Qualifications
   

  


 Qualifications
 



 Specific qualifications for the Cloud Architect position include:
 



  
 


* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent degree and/or experience
* Cloud architecture experience utilizing AWS, Azure, or GCP
* Demonstrated software development experience over 7\\+ years with a broad range of development tools and technologies
* Ability to think strategically and relate architectural decisions/recommendations to business needs and client culture.
* Ability and desire to lead multiple technical project teams
* Ability to compromise and build consensus on architectural issues
* In\\-depth experience with some or all of these cloud concepts: Infrastructure as a Service, Serverless Architecture, Container Architecture, Platform as a Service, Storage, Infrastructure as Code, and Identity and Access Management.
* Knowledge of the concepts and tools required for effective software development including: Integrated Development Environments, Continuous Integration, Operating Systems (specifically UNIX/Linux), Test\\-driven Development, SDLC Methodologies including Waterfall, Scrum, XP, Kanban, and SAFe.
* Cloud Architecture Certifications recommended but not required.
* Extensive knowledge of the concepts and tools required for effective software development including: Integrated Development Environments, Continuous Integration, Operating Systems (specifically UNIX/Linux), Test\\-driven Development, SDLC Methodologies including Waterfall, Scrum, XP, Kanban, and SAFe.


  

  

 Additional Information
   

  


 Additional information
 



 We want everyone at CapTech to be able to envision a lasting and rewarding career here, which is why we offer a variety of career paths based on your skills and passions.  You decide where and how you want to develop, and we help get you there with customizable career progression and a comprehensive benefits package to support you along the way.  Alongside our suite of traditional benefits encompassing generous PTO, health coverage, disability insurance, paid family leave and more, we’ve launched extended benefits to help meet our employees’ needs. 
 


* CapFlex – Employee\\-first mentality that supports a hybrid workforce and empowers daily flexibility while servicing our clients
* Learning \\& Development – Programs offering certification and tuition support, digital on\\-demand learning courses, mentorship, and skill development paths
* Modern Health –A mental health and well\\-being platform that provides 1:1 care, group support sessions, and self\\-serve resources to support employees and their families through life’s ups and downs
* Carrot Fertility –Inclusive fertility and family\\-forming coverage for all paths to parenthood – including adoption, surrogacy, fertility treatments, pregnancy, and more – and opportunities for employer\\-sponsored funds to help pay for care
* Fringe –A company paid stipend program for personalized lifestyle benefits, allowing employees to choose benefits that matter most to them – ranging from vendors like Netflix, Spotify, and GrubHub to services like student loan repayment, travel, fitness, and more
* Employee Resource Groups – Employee\\-led committees that embrace and incorporate diversity and inclusion into our day\\-to\\-day operations
* Philanthropic Partnerships – Opportunities to engage in partnerships and pro\\-bono projects that support our communities.
* 401(k) Matching – Generous matching and no vesting period to help you continue to build financial wellness



 CapTech is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a culture of equality, inclusion and fairness — each foundational to our core values.  We strive to create a diverse environment where each employee is encouraged to bring their unique ideas, backgrounds and experiences to the workplace. For more information about our Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging efforts, click HERE.  As part of this commitment, CapTech will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact Laura Massa directly via email lmassa@captechconsulting.com.
 



 At this time, CapTech cannot transfer nor sponsor a work visa for this position. Applicants must be authorized to work directly for any employer in the United States without visa sponsorship.

title: Procurement Manager
description:
**Nexus Circular** 
 is the commercial leader in advanced recycling technology that converts landfill\\-bound plastics into circular feedstocks for the production of sustainable virgin plastics for packaging and other applications. Nexus Circular’s end\\-to\\-end solution is economically validated as demonstrated by consistent bulk sales of high quality, ISCC Plus circular feedstocks for virgin plastic production. Aligned with global partners who seek proven scalable solutions to meet ambitious plastic circularity goals, Nexus Circular is rapidly expanding its innovation footprint worldwide, moving decisively to address the complex challenges of plastics accumulation in the environment.
   

  

 Nexus has built an outstanding culture. We are looking for people to contribute to a fast\\-paced, environmentally committed business that is focused on growth and sustainability. We are very collaborative, transparent, data driven, value diverse perspectives and are looking for constructive initiatives and new ideas. We are looking for self\\-starters and independent thinkers who work collaboratively in teams. Given the growth stage of Nexus, we are also looking for people who are comfortable moving between strategic thinking and executing those ideas to take Nexus to the next level.
   





**Role Overview:** 




 The
 **Sr** 
**Procurement Manager (Department Lead)** 
 is responsible for leading the procurement activities and developing a strategic plan for Nexus’ overall procurement including choice of project execution, internal team resources as well as continuing to improve policies and procedures. This role will implement procurement strategies primarily for major capital projects (notably for EPC) as well as develop sourcing for operations, and coordinate all of the procurement activities with all departments – projects, engineering, construction, legal and finance.
 



 This role reports to Nexus Circular’s CFO, EVP of Project Management.
 


**Key Responsibilities:** 
* Maintains and further develops the resources, organization, processes for procurement activities.
* Manages procurement and purchasing operations and implements the strategy to provide the materials and services to meet organizational requirements for quality, volume, availability, and pricing.
* Maintains and develops strategic supplier relationships, negotiates contracts, and implements systems for monitoring performance, assessing risk, and responding to changes in demand or disruptions in the supply chain.
* Collaborates with other functions, notably with Engineering, to define current and future equipment requirements.
* Implements processes and systems and utilizes technical tools to analyze data and increase responsiveness to material demands.
* Oversee auditing processes to ensure procurement and recordkeeping comply with any applicable industry or governmental regulations.



**Minimum Requirements:** 



* Bachelor's degree (in business, science, engineering, purchasing or logistics preferred)
* 10\\+ years of experience in mid\\-to\\-large capital projects in procurement for Engineering, Procurement, Construction. Experience.



**Additional Qualifications:** 



* A collaborative, supportive leader and team player; prior experience in building and managing team
* Experience in contracting and/or subcontracting and contract types for engineering, equipment and construction services in process industries.
* Experience in sourcing for production/operations/manufacturing.
* Have an outstanding track record of juggling multiple priorities and executing high\\-quality deliverables
* Excellent written and verbal skills required (samples may be requested)
* Competency in MS Office (especially PowerPoint, Word and Excel)



 Nexus has built an outstanding culture. We are looking for people to contribute to a fast\\-paced, environmentally committed business that is focused on growth and sustainability. We are very collaborative, transparent, data driven, value diverse perspectives and are looking for constructive initiatives and new ideas. We are looking for self\\-starters and independent thinkers who work collaboratively in teams. Given the growth stage of Nexus, we are also looking for people who are comfortable moving between strategic thinking and executing those ideas to take Nexus to the next level. Don’t meet all the listed requirements? At Nexus Circular, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. If you are excited about this role but your previous experience doesn’t align completely with the job, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles!
 



**Benefits:** 



* Eligible to contribute to Company’s Traditional 401(k) and Roth 401(k) upon hire with Company Contribution
* Medical (multiple comprehensive coverage levels), Dental and Vision coverage
* Group Health \\& Wellness Program, plus special savings on retail items, travel, entertainment, and more through Insperity Works
* Flexible Spending Accounts and Health Savings Accounts
* Basic and AD\\&D Life Insurance
* Voluntary benefits, including short\\-term and long\\-term disability insurance, accident, critical illness, and hospital confinement insurance.



 Note: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by the incumbent. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required for this position.
 



 Nexus Circular Is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to that individual’s age, race, color, religion or creed, national origin or ancestry, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, physical or mental disability, veteran status, genetic information, ethnicity, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by law. Nexus Circular provides reasonable accommodation when requested by a qualified applicant with a disability unless such accommodation causes undue hardship.

title: Senior ConnectShip Production Support Specialist
description:
**Before you apply to a job, select your language preference from the options available at the top right of this page.** 












 Explore your next opportunity at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. We know what it takes to lead UPS into tomorrow\\-people with a unique combination of skill \\+ passion. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.
 







**:** 




**Job Title:** 
 Senior ConnectShip Production Support Specialist
 







**Job Summary:** 
  

 We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior ConnectShip Production Support Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing, maintaining, and optimizing the ConnectShip and related shipping solutions in a production environment. This role requires advanced troubleshooting skills, in\\-depth knowledge of ConnectShip architecture, and a proactive approach to ensuring seamless shipping operations for the business.
 







**Key Responsibilities:** 




**ConnectShip System Administration:** 



* Manage and maintain ConnectShip server environments, including installation, configuration, and patch management.
* Ensure the stability and performance of ConnectShip components and related integrations.



**Production Support:** 



* Provide 24/7 support for production issues related to ConnectShip and associated systems.
* Troubleshoot and resolve complex shipping\\-related errors, ensuring minimal downtime.
* Monitor system performance and logs to proactively identify and resolve issues.



**Process Optimization:** 



* Work with cross\\-functional teams to implement and optimize ConnectShip configurations, including Ship Via codes, carrier modules, and shipping rules.
* Develop and document best practices for ConnectShip operations and maintenance.



**Collaboration and Communication:** 



* Serve as a point of contact between business teams, carriers, and IT for shipping\\-related requirements.
* Provide regular updates to stakeholders regarding production incidents and resolutions.



**Data Management:** 



* Generate and analyze reports on shipping performance and system activity.
* Manage and ensure the accuracy of shipping label configurations and tracking number mappings.



**Compliance and Security:** 



* Ensure compliance with carrier regulations and company policies.
* Implement security best practices and safeguards for ConnectShip environments.



**Required Skills and Qualifications:** 



* Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
* 5\\+ years of experience in production support, with a focus on ConnectShip or similar shipping software solutions.
* Expertise in ConnectShip components, including PMC and carrier module configurations.
* Strong troubleshooting skills, particularly with ConnectShip logs, IIS, and system\\-level diagnostics.
* Experience with SQL Server, XML, and scripting (e.g., PowerShell, Batch) for data extraction and automation.
* Familiarity with shipping carrier systems (e.g., UPS, FedEx, USPS) and related compliance requirements.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively across teams.
* Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple priorities in a fast\\-paced production environment.



**Preferred Qualifications:** 



* Knowledge of .NET, C\\#, and web services related to ConnectShip integrations.
* Experience with E2Open or other shipping platforms is a plus.
* Familiarity with ITIL processes and change management practices.



**What We Offer:** 



* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Opportunities for career growth and professional development.
* A collaborative and innovative work environment.







 If you are passionate about production support and shipping technologies, we encourage you to apply and become a key member of our team.
 







 Grade: 20i
 







**Employee Type:** 



 Permanent
 




 UPS is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.
 











**Other Criteria:** 




 Employer will sponsor visas for specific positions. UPS is an equal opportunity employer. UPS does not discriminate on the basis of race/color/religion/sex/national origin/veteran/disability/age/sexual orientation/gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.
 










 Employment Type: OTHER

title: Logistic Manager Assistant
description:
A well established, high\\-end food company is looking for an Assistant Transportation \\& Logistics Manager to support strategic logistics and customer service operations and supervise the warehouse and logistics teams.
 







 This role will be responsible for planning, coordinating, and monitoring logistics operations, including customer service, warehousing, inventory, transportation, and supply chain processes.
   

  

**Responsibilities** 



* Serve as the liaison with Sales, Production, and Global Logistics staff on the delivery of cost\\-effective customer service
* Conduct hiring, training, and management for warehouse staff and logistics specialists.
* Assist with coordinating daily operations of multiple distribution centers across the US
* Maintain communication with suppliers, carriers, customers, and internal departments regarding logistics operations.
* Develop new strategies to streamline processes and reduce cost
* Perform metrics reporting and data analysis tasks to identify issues and opportunities for process improvements
* Prioritization of orders and adjusting of schedules to ensure customer priority requirement are met
* Serve as the liaison with Sales, Production, and Global Logistics staff on the delivery of cost\\-effective customer service
* Ensure efficient scheduling and routing to and from plants and their customers to achieve lowest total costs and on\\-time in\\-full (OTIF) delivery
* Handle all questions or concerns with inbound/ outbound shipments and resolve customer service issues.
* Identify opportunities for improvement and collaborate with senior leadership, partners and external vendors to achieve organizational objectives.
* Coordinate and supervise daily activities of warehouse/driver personnel including route assignments, vehicle assignments, customer deliveries and vendor pick\\-ups.
* Support the Logistics Manager by coordinating the movement of goods throughout the supply chain, including tracking shipments, processing orders, communicating with carriers and customers, ensuring timely deliveries, and resolving logistics\\-related issues
* Complete, process and confirm purchase orders and invoices for outside customers
* Monitor outstanding transactions and ensure they are processed in timely manner
* Address and resolve customer inquiries and complaints related to deliveries
* Oversee cost estimating process performed within Customer Service
* Assist with implementation and improvement for Supply Chain procedures



















**Qualifications** 



* Bachelors degree in engineering, Supply Chain, Business Administration or related
* Minimum of 7\\+ years of experience in logistics, warehouse, or transportation operations
* Proven leadership and management skills along with strong collaboration and communication abilities with associates to C\\-level leaders
* Experience managing, coaching, and training direct reports
* Advanced knowledge of shipping and receiving and warehouse operations
* Working knowledge of logistics and inventory software
* Ability to interact with Logistics Team, Customers and Vendors.
* Responsible for crafting/creating Daily Warehouse Shipping Schedule and outbound shipment scheduling
* Exemplary time management skills; self\\-directed, able to multitask and meet deadlines
* Attention to detail, keen organizational skills and problem\\-solving abilities

title: Production Engineer I (Module) / Korean Bilingual
description:
**Description** 




**SUMMARY**
 The Production Engineer I, under the direction of the Production Manager will provide support in the day\\-to\\-day operations of the manufacturing process. The Production Engineer will collect, validate, analyze, and organize data into meaningful reports for management decision making. Duties include creating production schedules, conferring with department supervisors to determine the progress of work and completion dates, inventory levels and solving production problems. The Production Engineer also compiles information into operational reports and leads cross\\-departmental initiatives to meet building\\-wide goals. Ideal candidate possesses strong background in Operations, Planning/Scheduling, Program Management, Continuous Improvement and Data Analytics.
 

  
 

**RESPONSIBILITIES:** 

* Work closely with production management in both ongoing reporting, as well as in the development of analytical tools to enhance production volume and profitability.
* Identify production issues, analyze root causes and drive resolutions.
* Work with Production Manager in budget analysis and preparation; development of operating goals for productivity, quality and safety.
* Compile and analyze company data and create reports for management’s review
* Provide production line support including, but not limited to, implementing process improvements, troubleshooting equipment, and addressing operator inquiries.
* Utilize LEAN, Six Sigma, and other best practice tools and principles for day\\-to\\-day problem solving and continuous improvement.
* Lead the implementation of new manufacturing initiatives, including strategic resource allocation and applying good manufacturing principles, organization structure, leadership, sourcing and integration, production systems and techniques for improved efficiencies and adherence to best practice.
* Keeps records, manages direct and indirect labor costs, coordinates with other departments to ensure material availability, staffing, capacity, machine availability and profitability.
* Analyze statistical trends to develop KPIs with internal partners to set performance benchmarking.
* Work with planning and scheduling, developing complete production plans, assigning personnel; establishing priorities; monitoring progress; revising schedules; resolving problems and reporting results of production processes.
* Creation of mechanisms to improve production and streamline workflow
* Identify and develop new reporting methods, templates, and tools to drive improvement across all business areas.
* Adhere to the policies and procedures of Hanwha Q Cells.
* Perform other duties and special project, as assigned by management.



**REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:** 

* Bachelor’s degree in engineering or related field.
* 0\\-3\\+ years of related experience.
* Fluency in Korean REQUIRED
* Impeccable math and analytic skills
* Must be comfortable with integrating new technology into an existing business environment.
* Strong data analysis, data verification, problem\\-solving abilities.
* Advanced knowledge with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Power Point).
* Able to prioritize and execute tasks in a high\\-pressure environment.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Knowledge of Lean Manufacturing, Continuous Improvement, 5S, Lean/Six Sigma.
* Advanced proficiency in using ERP/MES systems.
* Able to stand and walk the production area throughout the workday
* Able to lift to 50 pounds without restriction
* Reaching, pushing, pulling, or lifting as required within limits set by Q Cells
* Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer



  
 

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:** 

* Ability to filter “Big Data” and interpret for data driven decision making.
* Extensive experience implementing new programs and data systems.
* Ability to utilize abstract reasoning techniques to build reporting logic and establish creative solutions to new problems.
* The ability to work with ambiguous data sets and information, using people skills and intuition to navigate solutions.
* Ability to learn various software applications required for quality and performance reporting and analysis.



  
 

*Hanwha Q CELLS provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics.*

title: Senior Construction Estimator
description:
### About Heery:



  

  


  
 



 Founded in 1952 and formerly known as Heery International Inc., the firm operates throughout the United States as part of Turner \\& Townsend. It specializes in project and program management for public sector organizations, with industry\\-leading experts in corporate, cultural, healthcare, justice, sports, K\\-12 education, higher education, aviation and government facilities.
 



 Recognized for service excellence by a broad spectrum of professional organizations and industry publications, the talented multidisciplinary team at Turner \\& Townsend Heery exceeds client expectations — adding value, best practice and expertise at every turn. The team's unique client\\-centric culture is integrated into each project and reflects a passion for the built environment and staying true to the client’s vision.
 


 Job Description
   

  


  
 



 Turner \\& Townsend Heery is seeking a Senior Estimator to work with our Atlanta team providing estimating, change management and conformance check services on major construction projects for a well\\-known client. 
 



**\\*On\\-site presence is required.** 




**Responsibilities:** 



* Provide estimate and cost planning to include producing and presenting the final cost plan.
* Ability to estimate at conceptual, programming and detailed level.
* Perform accurate quantity surveys for all types of construction systems and materials.
* Assist with the preparation of detailed cost estimates for all types of projects.
* Assist in providing feasibility studies and using the application of parametric benchmark cost data.
* Provide reasoned and rational cost advice on elements of cost estimating and planning.
* Understand local market rates and project nuances
* Contribute to benchmark library and advise on accuracy of cost advice and estimates received from external parties.
* Provide benchmarking studies, analysis of cost data and presentation of data in reports.
* Undertake cost assurance of third\\-party estimates, report writing and presentation.
* Ability to perform all aspects of procurement, including managing the pre\\-qualification stage, produce bid list, bid analysis, produce bid report, and compile contractual documents.
* Participate effectively with post contract cost variances and the change control processes.
* Review proposed change documents and pricing as assigned.
* Provide project document constructability reviews.
* Attend meetings as assigned.
* Make site visits with project/construction management as appropriate.
* Manage cost checks and carry out valuations on larger projects, and ensure timely and accurate cost checking, and valuation process.
* Produce monthly cost reports and present to clients.
* Provide input into value engineering and options analysis.
* Maintain liaison with client and other consultants at all projects stages.
* Identify opportunities to develop new business with existing clients and report such opportunities to appropriate line manager and utilize marketing database.
* Identify improvements for cost estimating procedures, templates, and products, and refer ideas to appropriate line manager.
* Performs work in a safe manner and actively encourages others to comply with safety rules and regulations.
* SOX control responsibilities may be part of this role, which are to be adhered to where applicable.


 Qualifications
   

  


**Educational and Professional Qualifications:** 



* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Architecture, Building Construction from a four\\-year college or university.
* Must have three (3\\) years of significant quantity survey and pricing experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
* Prior experience as a project or field engineer desirable.
* Demonstrated experience working as a lead estimator on large scale and complex construction projects.
* Demonstrate experience of all elements of estimating construction projects, including but not limited to Civil, Structural, Architectural and MEP elements.
* US construction experience is required.
* Proven track record managing large\\-scale and complex projects.
* Must possess exemplary communication skills – both written and oral.
* Must be a “self\\-starter,” and a goal/results\\-oriented leader and team player.
* Perform all of the duties above through the use/preparation of Bid Analysis Sheets, Change Control Forms, Cost Estimating Software, and Take\\-off Software.
* Competency using Excel, Word, PowerPoint, CostX, Bluebeam.


  

  

 Additional Information
   

  


  
 



**\\*On\\-site presence and requirements may change depending on our client's needs** 




 Our inspired people share our vision and mission. We provide a great place to work, where each person has the opportunity and voice to affect change. 
 



 We want our people to succeed both in work and life. To support this we promote a healthy, productive and flexible working environment that respects work\\-life balance.  
 



 Turner \\& Townsend is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and actively encourage applications from all sectors of the community. 
 



 Please find out more about us at www.turnerandtownsend.com/ 
 



 Turner \\& Townsend does not accept any speculative or unsolicited CV’s that have been sent to our internal recruitment team or hiring managers from agencies outside of our preferred supplier list or that have not followed due process. Any speculative or unsolicited CV’s will be treated as a direct application. 
 



  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. 
 



 \\#LI\\-KO1
 





 Join our social media conversations for more information about Turner \\& Townsend and our exciting future projects: 
 



 Twitter
 



 Instagram
 



 LinkedIn
 



*It is strictly against Turner \\& Townsend policy for candidates to pay any fee in relation to our recruitment process. No recruitment agency working with Turner \\& Townsend will ask candidates to pay a fee at any time.* 




*Any unsolicited resumes/CVs submitted through our website or to Turner \\& Townsend personal e\\-mail accounts, are considered property of Turner \\& Townsend and are not subject to payment of agency fees. In order to be an authorised Recruitment Agency/Search Firm for Turner \\& Townsend, there must be a formal written agreement in place and the agency must be invited, by the Recruitment Team, to submit candidates for review.*

title: Technology Designer
description:
At Salas O’Brien we tell our clients that we’re engineered for impact. This passion for making a difference applies just as much to our team as it does to our projects. That’s why we’re committed to living our values every day: inspiring, achieving, and connecting as shared owners of our success with a focus on a sustainable future.
 



 Building for the long\\-term means that all of our team members can expect to work on amazing projects with a people\\-first approach to problem solving. It also means that each member of our team has truly limitless potential to build a unique, meaningful, and high\\-impact career—and they’ll receive great total rewards along the way.
 



**About Us:** 




 Founded in 1975, Salas O’Brien is an employee\\-owned engineering and professional services firm focused on achieving impact for our clients, our team, and the world. We know that tomorrow’s requirements are today’s opportunities, and we are here to design lasting solutions for pressing challenges.
 



 We work across a variety of industries providing integrated engineering and consulting services. Our specialized experience includes design for data centers, healthcare, science and technology, high\\-rise buildings, clean energy, education, and other building types as well as structural and building sciences, infrastructure asset management, advanced robotics, and more.
 



 Our technical expertise is paired with an exceptional team of business development, human resources, finance and accounting, information technology, and marketing professionals, all of whom play a key role in bringing our commitments to life every day.
 



**Job Summary:** 




 We are seeking an exceptional Technology Design Specialist to join our successful and collaborative team. The ideal candidate will be experienced with Revit and have strong communications skills. In this role, you will coordinate our project efforts with team members from other Engineering disciplines, document the design and construction progress of the Technology scope, and take a key role in production of Technology design documentation.
 



 Our technology scope includes Communications, Security, Audio Visual (AV) and more, providing a diverse and rewarding challenge as well as offering strong growth opportunities.
 



 General Duties:
 


* Collaborate with our Technology department head and other members of our Technology department to drive project outcomes, fostering a highly collaborative approach.
* Technology Design tasks utilizing Revit and AutoCAD or Bluebeam.
* Meet virtually or in\\-person with our Clients to understand their Technology needs.
* Review project documents, understanding intent and expectations of clients.
* Assist in review to product data and shop drawing submittals.
* Assist in review and response to RFI’s, CPR’s, ASI’s, and RFP’s.
* Perform QA/ QC reviews of project documents during multiple phases of design.
* Manage multiple concurrent projects to ensure on\\-time delivery.



  

 Skills:
 


* Experience with Revit, AutoCAD and/or Bluebeam applications.
* Proficient in Microsoft Word/Excel/Outlook.
* Excellent communication and organizational skills.




 Qualifications:
 


* 3\\-5 years’ experience with Revit
* Experience with AutoCAD and/or Bluebeam preferred
* Experience designing low voltage systems preferred
* Familiarity with Structured Cabling systems
* Interest in pursuing Registered Communications Distribution Design (RCDD) certification







**Location** 
 : Atlanta, GA
   

**Travel** 
 : 5%
   

**\\#LI\\-Hybrid** 




**Equal Opportunity Employment Statement**
 Salas O’Brien provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state/provincial, or local laws. Salas O’Brien will accommodate the disability\\-related needs of applicants as required by law.

title: Project Manager-Siemens Real Estate (Midwest, East Coast, or Texas)
description:
Siemens Real Estate (SRE) wants you as our next Project Manager (Mid\\-West US Region). Are you wondering how we will work in the future. And how do we manage to put people at the center of this.
 



 How can buildings become the key to sustainable growth. And how can you save CO2 by collecting data. Then come to us, we look forward to receiving your application.
 



 Siemens Real Estate is responsible for Siemens' global real estate portfolio. Worldwide, we are responsible for 8\\.7 million square meters of office and production space at around 1,400 locations. We plan, build and design
 



 We operate and provide associated services. We are passionate about people, our planet and business requirements. We bring decades of experience and state\\-of\\-the\\-art technical know\\-how over the entire life cycle of real estate.
 



 We offer solutions for the transformation of our working world and for sustainable growth. You will need to be located in Midwest, East Coast, or Texas. As a Project Manager, your responsibilities would include, but not be limited to: Project Planning and Execution Develop comprehensive project plans, including schedules, cost estimates, and resource allocation.
 



 Coordinate with internal teams and external stakeholders to ensure project milestones are met. Monitor project progress and adjust as necessary to ensure successful completion. Plan and manage technical projects, ensuring they align with overall business objectives.
 



 Coordinate Siemens office requirements for furniture, space planning, IT, security, and other cross functional partners. Engagement of and coordination with Siemens EH\\&S, Security, IT, and AV project managers. Coordination, ordering, and installation oversight of furniture and equipment for projects.
 



 Stakeholder Management Serve as the primary point of contact for clients, contractors, and other stakeholders. Facilitate regular meetings to update stakeholders on project status and address any concerns. Ensure clear and consistent communication throughout the project lifecycle.
 



 Risk Management Identify potential project risks and develop mitigation strategies. Conduct regular risk assessments and implement contingency plans as needed. Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations and standards.
 



 Execute local Environmental, Health, and Safety (EHS) aspects to minimize risks and ensure legally compliant operations, fostering a zero\\-harm culture. Financial Oversight Manage project budgets, ensuring costs are controlled and financial objectives are met. Prepare and present financial reports to senior management.
 



 Approve expenditures and ensure all financial documentation is accurate and up to date. Develop detailed cost estimates for various types of projects, including expansions, fit\\-outs, lease end dates, maintenance, and new locations. Develop and implement technical concepts/projects to reduce costs.
 



 Quality Assurance Ensure all project deliverables meet the highest quality standards. Conduct regular site inspections and quality checks. Address any quality issues promptly and effectively.
 



 Team Leadership Lead and motivate project teams, providing guidance and support as needed. Foster a collaborative and productive team environment. Conduct performance reviews and provide feedback to team members.
 



 Compliance Ensure adherence to construction principles, guidelines, and processes. Steer and ensure adherence to local building standards and regulations, including proper documentation and required permits. Portfolio Management Manage a portfolio of 15\\-20 projects, ensuring each project is delivered on time and within budget.
 



 Project Communications Develop and implement communication plans to ensure all stakeholders are informed of project progress and changes. Prepare and distribute regular project updates, reports, and presentations. Facilitate effective communication between project teams, clients, and other stakeholders.
 



 Address any communication issues promptly to maintain project alignment and stakeholder satisfaction. Basic Requirements: Bachelor's degree in real estate, Construction Management, Business Administration, or a related field. 7\\+ years of experience in real estate, with a minimum of 5 years in project management within commercial real estate or construction sector.
 



 7\\+ years of experience of successfully managing mid to large\\-scale projects. Proficiency in project management software (e.g., MS Project) with a minimum of 5 years of experience using it to develop project schedules and show the critical path. 7\\+ years of experience in commercial/light warehouse construction to include mechanical, electrical, plumbing, building automation systems, and tenant improvement projects
 



 Ability to read and understand construction drawings and specifications. 10\\+ years of experience in strong project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. 10\\+ years of experience using SharePoint.
 



 5\\+ years of experience with Microsoft Teams for collaborating across multiple groups. Ability and willingness to travel as needed for project site visits and stakeholder meetings. Must be authorized to work in the US without the need for sponsorship now or in the future.
 



 Preferred Requirements: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Solid understanding of financial management and budgeting. Strong problem\\-solving and decision\\-making abilities.
 



 Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines. Certifications PMP (Project Management Professional) certification preferred.
 



 LEED (Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design) accreditation is a plus. You'll benefit from: Siemens offers a variety of health and wellness benefits to our employees. Details regarding our benefits can be found here: https://www.benefitsquickstart.com/siemens/index.html The pay range for this position is $89,670 to $153,720 and the annual target incentive will be 10% of the base salary
 



 The actual wage offered may be lower or higher depending on budget and candidate experience, knowledge, skills, qualifications, and premium geographic location. Transform the every day with us. About Siemens: We are a global technology company focused on industry, infrastructure, transport, and healthcare.
 



 From more resource\\-efficient factories, resilient supply chains, and smarter buildings and grids, to sustainable transportation as well as advanced healthcare, we create technology with the purpose of adding real value for customers. Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion: We value your unique identity and perspective. We are fully committed to providing equitable opportunities and building a workplace that reflects the diversity of society.
 



 Come bring your authentic self and create a better tomorrow with us. Learn more about our commitment to DEI here. Protecting the environment, conserving our natural resources, fostering the health and performance of our people as well as safeguarding their working conditions are core to our social and business commitment at Siemens.
 



 They are an integral part of our Business Conduct Guidelines and our corporate strategy. \\#LI\\-JE1 Equal Employment Opportunity Statement Siemens is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship status, ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability unrelated to ability, marital status, family responsibilities, pregnancy, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, transgender, sex stereotyping, order of protection status, protected veteran or military status, or an unfavorable discharge from military service, and other categories protected by federal, state or local law.
 



 Reasonable Accommodations If you require a reasonable accommodation in completing a job application, interviewing, completing any pre\\-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please fill out the accommodations form by clicking on this link Accommodation for disability form. If you're unable to complete the form, you can reach out to our AskHR team for support at 1\\-866\\-743\\-6367\\. Please note our AskHR representatives do not have visibility of application or interview status.
 



 EEO is the Law Applicants and employees are protected under Federal law from discrimination. To learn more, Click here. Pay Transparency Non\\-Discrimination Provision Siemens follows Executive Order 11246, including the Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision.
 



 To learn more, Click here. California Privacy Notice California residents have the right to receive additional notices about their personal information. To learn more, click here.
 



 Criminal History Qualified applications with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with applicable local and state laws.

title: Project Manager ll, Applied Projects - REQ # 1178
description:
**Mitsubishi Electric Trane HVAC US LLC is looking for a Project Manager ll, Applied Projects in NYC.** 




**POSITION SUMMARY:** 




 The Project Manager ll is responsible for the project management and field activities supporting waterside and airside products, within their assigned territory. Responsibilities include project execution, time \\& materials management, project work\\-flow management, cost \\& billing management, and staff \\& resources allocation as necessary. The Project Manager will also attend project jobsite for various activities with internal and external customers and perform sales and engineering functions on an as\\-needed basis. Additional responsibilities include assisting with commercial project operations, support of \\& coordination with other METUS departments and continuous improvement efforts as needed.
 



**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS** 




**The essential functions of the position include, but are not limited to the following:** 



* Act as the main project liaison during the implementation phase of commercial domestic hot water, energy, building automation project for METUS through close collaboration with internal teams, distribution, and contractors.
* Responsible for the review of technical applications of Applied Projects in their territory. Providing system design review, including custom logic / sequence review of all projects with Sales \\& Engineering teams.
* Review for accuracy all project design documents, prior to issuance to the customer. Review to include engineered drawings, submittals and other project documentation as required by the project specifications \\& Applied Projects standards and best practices.
* Perform in\\-field project activities as required for installation, start\\-up, and commissioning.
* Prepare, review and approve project closeout documentation, including but not limited to: O\\&Ms, as built \\& record drawings, database backups and other required collateral required by the project specifications \\& Applied Projects standards and best practices.
* Assist sales staff with technical applications and estimation of project costs, as required.

* Team player demonstrating METUS core values including a desire to win together, deliver excellence, drive sustainability, focus on execution and learn continuously.

title: Implementation Manager, Sales - Remote
description:
The
 **Sales Implementation Manager** 
 oversees the deployment and integration of a company's products or services for clients, ensuring that projects are delivered on time, within budget, and to the client's specifications. They coordinate internal teams, manage customer expectations, and ensure smooth transitions from sales to active service. The role is both strategic and operational, blending project management, customer service, and technical expertise.
 







**Specific duties include, but are not limited to:** 





****Project Management:****



* Lead the execution of product implementations, ensuring timely delivery and adherence to budget.
* Develop and manage project timelines, milestones, and deliverables.
* Coordinate the efforts of internal teams (e.g., operations, product, sales support) to deliver on implementation goals.
* Monitor project progress and adjust plans as necessary to address obstacles or risks.







****Customer Interaction:****



* Serve as the main point of contact for clients during the implementation phase.
* Understand the client's business needs and translate them into implementation requirements.
* Provide training and support to clients during the onboarding process.
* Ensure clients are satisfied with the implementation and address any concerns or issues.







****Stakeholder Communication:****



* Regularly update internal teams and senior leadership on project status, risks, and successes.
* Prepare reports and presentations on project health and deliverables for stakeholders







****Quality Assurance \\& Risk Management:****



* Identify risks and roadblocks early in the process and develop mitigation strategies.
* Ensure that the final implementation meets the company's quality standards and client expectations.







****Continuous Improvement:****



* Analyze feedback and performance data to improve the implementation process.
* Develop best practices and standard operating procedures for efficient project delivery.
* Work closely with product and engineering teams to understand new features and how they can be incorporated into client projects








**Position Requirements:** 



* Bachelor's degree.
* 3\\-5 years of experience in project management, preferably in a technical or healthcare environment.
* Proven track record of managing complex, multi\\-phase implementation projects.
* Experience in client\\-facing roles and building strong customer relationships.
* Effective and efficient at using MS Office software, and other standard PC operations, to communicate and be productive.
* Demonstrates accountability and takes personal responsibility for results.
* Possess ability to develop and find leads through Salesforce.com, public domains and other sources as appropriate.
* Effectively communicate and work in partnership with colleagues and all internal company's Team Members.
* Displays appropriate organizational skills and is able to manage varying responsibilities, meetings, customers, etc. while maintaining productivity and delivering results.
* Prioritizes relationship building and effectively develops strategic partners both with colleagues as well as with current and potential customers.
* Exhibits effective sales and business acumen, displaying fundamental knowledge of the imaging market and sales strategies and is able to apply those skills to deliver on results.
* Leverages strong organizational and strategic planning skills to effectively manage a geographic territory and build upon past success.
* Consistently exhibits and results\\-oriented approach and mindset.
* 50% Travel may be required.







**Physical Requirements:** 




 Standard office environment and may be exposed to environmental hazards such as exposure to noise, and travel.
 







 More than 50% of the time:
 


* Sit, stand, and walk.

* See, speak and hear to be able to communicate with patients.







 Less than 50% of the time:
 


* Stoop, kneel or crawl.

title: Director, New Technologies Engineering
description:
Overview
 
 This individual will be responsible for the leadership of the New Technologies Engineering group consisting of Lithium Battery development, Battery Charger development (including Power Management development) and Software development. They will be responsible for delivery of solutions for a wide range of energy storage and energy management needs including Motive Power, Battery Energy Storage Systems, Network Power and Transportation applications. They will also be required to continuously develop the Engineering teams within their organization to effectively and efficiently meet any development needs in these markets including refining Engineering structure and institution of Product development and delivery processes. Finally, they will be required to report out higher level leadership teams on progress in their area of responsibility.
 


 Responsibilities
 * Drives delivery of new products in line with business needs and the strategic business plan.
* Drives delivery of Engineering designs for Engineer to Order customer solutions.
* Responsible for departmental budget planning and execution of spending to budget to achieve business needs.
* Collaborate with the Product Management team to help define new product opportunities and evaluate market required products for feasibility and cost.
* Effectively communicate to higher level leadership team on status of projects and product developments.
* Develop, Deploy and Manage Standardized design processes
* Conduct post\\-mortem analysis of closed projects and adopt best practices and lessons learned.
* Lead and monitor resolution efforts on complex issues where analysis of situations or data requires in\\-depth evaluation of variable factors.
* Develop relationships with local plant teams, functional leaders, VPs, etc. to ensure smooth progression of projects and initiatives.
* Previous experience in developing and launching products to the market is required.


 Qualifications
 
 Education, Experience, Certifications
 


* Bachelor's degree in technical related field required; Electrical Engineering degree preferred
* MBA in related field preferred
* 15\\+ years of previous Product Development, Engineering Leadership and Project Management experience is required.
* Previous cross\\-functional experience in Manufacturing and Engineering preferred.



 Competencies, Skills, Knowledge
 


* Challenges the status quo, act as a change agent to drive results and measurable improvements.
* Strong organization, analytical, time\\-management and communication skills.
* Outstanding Leadership: Ability to influence leaders and cross functional peers and drive results.
* Excellent Oral and Written communication skills
* Ability to handle conflict management.
* Self\\-Starter: Ability to be efficient and productive while working independent of direct supervision
* Product delivery experience a must as well as the ability to handle multiple\\-tasks and meet deadlines.
* MS Office skills especially, MS\\-Project, Word, Power Point, Visio, and Excel.
* Knowledge of project management tools and Methodologies, especially waterfall methodology.



 Environment \\& Physical Demands
 


* This position is based in our Alpharetta, GA office.
* This role requires travel to various sites, which may involve driving or flying.
* Visits to the manufacturing floor are required as needed. This involves standing and walking for extended periods, navigating around machinery and equipment, and occasionally bending, stooping, or crouching to inspect work areas.
* Must wear appropriate PPE when on the manufacturing floor, which may include safety glasses, hard hats, ear protection, and steel\\-toed boots, etc.



 Travel
 


* Travel 20\\-30% of the year


 EEO Statement
 
 Stryten Energy is an equal opportunity employer where an applicant's qualifications are considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other basis prohibited by law.
 


 About StatementStryten Energy helps solve the world's most pressing energy challenges with a broad range of energy storage solutions across the Essential Power, Motive Power, Transportation, Military and Government sectors. Headquartered in Alpharetta, Georgia, we partner with some of the world's most recognized companies to meet the growing demand for reliable and sustainable energy storage capacity. Stryten powers everything from submarines to subcompacts, microgrids, warehouses, distribution centers, cars, trains and trucks. Our stored energy technologies include advanced lead, lithium and vanadium redox flow batteries, intelligent chargers and energy performance management software that keep people on the move and supply chains running. An industry leader backed by more than a century of expertise, Stryten has The Energy to Challenge the status quo and deliver top\\-performing energy solutions for today and tomorrow. description:

title: Supply Chain Manager
description:
**The Company** 
 Imerysis the world's leading supplier of mineral\\-based specialty solutions for the industry with 3\\.8 billion in revenue and 13,700 employees in 54 countries in 2023\\. The Group offers high value\\-added and functional solutions to a wide range of industries and fast\\-growing markets such as solutions for the energy transition and sustainable construction, as well as natural solutions for consumer goods. Imerys draws on its understanding of applications, technological knowledge, and expertise in material science to deliver solutions which contribute essential properties to customers' products and their performance. As part of its commitment to responsible development, Imerys promotes environmentally friendly products and processes in addition to supporting its customers in their decarbonization efforts.
 







**The Position** 
 Supply Chain Manager
 











**Job Summary** 

 Based at our Norfolk, VA, plant, you will develop/Review logistics/distribution strategies and processes to deliver customers or for entering new markets with local production and through trading activities.
 



 Development and support of Supply Chain/Logistic/Customer Service team across sites
 



 Work closely with Manufacturing, Sales and Purchasing to create a timely and cost\\- effective domestic/import/export supply chain.
 



 Be responsible for the performance of domestic and international carriers and logistics intermediaries.
 



 Ensure compliance with international and domestic laws related to import/export activity.
 



 Evaluate tradeoffs between transportation cost, inventory cost and service levels.
 







****Responsibilities:****



* Responsible for all aspects of receiving, operations planning and distribution/ transportation (Rail / Road / sea export)
* Ensure effective team development, collaboration and support through setting and monitoring annual performance plans, career development and cooperative spirit
* Maintain accountability for the supply chain operating budget

* Embrace and build the necessary capability to adapt the team, stocks, resources, etc.
* Ensure customer needs are met, advising the Imerys production and sales teams of client expectations , and coordinate response to opportunities and challenges
* Support 3PL partnership to ensure adherence to budget, business processes, procedures and practices
* Work with key leaders/function in the corporate office to ensure smooth communication and resolve issues
* Serve as a key member of the supply chain network across the system in developing our functional capability
* Develop strong relationships with customer procurement and Imerys production/supply chain to ensure "best in class" customer satisfaction.
* Provide timely and accurate reporting of activities and customer information to meet Imerys reporting requirements
* Be the Customer Experience ambassador for RAC Supply Chain Scope in Americas



  

****Skills and experiences****



* Master's degree in Supply Chain Management, Operations, Engineering, Business or other related area
* 5\\-7 years of experience in supply chain management in a worldwide environment; (preferably with post\\-graduate Certification in Transportation \\& Logistics (CTL) or certification APICS
* Working knowledge of inventory management, production scheduling, DRP
* Deep knowledge ERP \\- Information Systems
* Fluent english knowledge
* Excellent organizational and planning skills
* Excellent knowledge of data analysis and forecasting methods
* An analytical mind with strong math skills
* Approximately 30% travel
* Excellent ability to promote new ideas and implement new processes/tools to support profitable business development and customer satisfaction.
* Outstanding communication and interpersonal abilities with ability to actively build and maintain critical relationships internally and externally

 Full time
 
 and
 


 Permanent

title: Delivery Architect Director- Oracle Cloud SCM Solution Architect
description:

 Qualified candidates will work on Oracle Cloud SCM (Order Management, Inventory, Procurement and Logistics) implementations as Senior Solution Architects.  This position’s primary function is to provide applications and solutions consulting to the customer and project team by understanding, analyzing and translating those requirements to enhance, support and facilitate effective solutions through either configuration or team development.

 * Strong Aerospace and Defense/Industrial Complex manufacturing experience with Oracle SaaS Applications.
* Facilitating client process walkthroughs to understand business processes and alignment with solution functionality.
* Acting in a client facing role to determine business requirements.
* Identifying how the Oracle Cloud SCM solution can be best utilized to meet client requirements.
* Providing support to the interface workstream to understand business scenarios and integration between the solution and other applications.
* Supporting configuration, testing, training, data migration and change management workstreams.
* Project management or team lead of large Oracle Cloud SCM implementation
* Be the design lead of Oracle Cloud SCM implementations for the modules in your expertise.
* Shape Oracle Cloud SCM solutions to help our clients solve complex situations.
* Deliver also advisory services in broader technology\\-enabled business change (integrator selection, vendor selection, application studies, solution architecture, or program diagnostics and recovery).
* Deliver advisory services to the most innovative client organizations.
* Building and maintaining client relationships Qualifications


 Required Skills:
 * Strong Aerospace and Defense/Industrial Complex manufacturing experience with Oracle SaaS Applications – specifically Order Management, Inventory, Procurement and Logistics
* 10 Year experience in complex Oracle SCM Implementations.

* Strong communication and leading skills.
* Understanding of Planning Business Processes.
* This role will require experience in pre\\-sales solutioning as well as the ability to lead a project team through the software development lifecycle.


 Qualifications
 * Bachelor’s Degree
* 7 to 10 years of experiences in the IT profession
* A minimum of 5 years of experience with Oracle Cloud Supply Chain applications
* At\\-least 2\\-3 full lifecycle implementation of SAAS SCM modules
* Seeking highly motivated professionals with excellent personal and communication skills and strong experience with the Oracle Cloud SCM applications


  Life at Capgemini

* Flexible work

It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55\\-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end\\-to\\-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22\\.5 billion.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender identity/expression, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, genetics, veteran status, marital status or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Director - Airline Revenue Management
description:
You Lead the Way. We've Got Your Back. With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways.
 



 When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you'll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that's unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally. At American Express, you'll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact\\-every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company's success.
 



 Together, we'll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world's best customer experience every day. And we'll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong. Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.
 



 American Express entered the travel agency business in 1915 and today is one of the world's largest luxury travel and lifestyle service networks. The Travel \\& Lifestyle Services (TLS) business provides exclusive access, differentiated value, extraordinary service, and unrivaled expertise to premium Card Members seeking leisure or business travel, as well as a variety of lifestyle services. The TLS COE (Center of Excellence) is tasked with uniting the travel and lifestyle benefits and strategic travel partner relationships globally to create structured and focused plans towards advanced Card Member engagement with Amex travel benefits.
 



 The Revenue Management \\& Analytics team within Amex Travel is a newly forming, fast\\-growth division that will play a key role in informing our global travel strategy, strengthening partner relationships, and catalyzing overall enterprise business growth through data driven insights and financial reporting. As the Director of Revenue Management, you will be responsible for leading a team focused on data analytics and financial planning to inform the Amex Travel partnerships team on incentive structures that will advance our partner relationships with top travel brands. You will be focused on creating a revenue management strategy to optimize partner contracts and sales performance that will advance our partner relationships with top travel brands.
 



 This Director will also lead the charge on creating clear reporting, forecasting revenue targets and partnering with the Account Management team on strategies to achieve set targets. Given the nature of these partnerships, it is essential that candidates have experience working in the airline industry, especially in airline revenue management To achieve these ambitions, it is imperative that this leader builds strong relationships and collaborates effectively with Enterprise stakeholders, including the Account Management, Marketing and Finance teams. The ideal candidate will have excellent interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills.
 



 Responsibilities: Formulate and execute pricing and inventory management strategies Provide data analysis, project management, contract negotiation and partnership management Create, identify, and supporting new revenue drivers Support new product development to drive engagement and deepen partnerships Participate in and lead strategic projects Create and maintain key relationships with internal stakeholders and external contacts Effectively communicate revenue performance and competitive market dynamics Own and manage core revenue and analytics KPIs through dynamic dashboards, executive presentations, and progress tracking. Establish and implement strategies that drive revenue growth generation among key customer segments and revenue centers. Lead alignment and execution of revenue goals across TLS, ensuring integration with all departments.
 



 Qualifications: \\*\\*\\*Previous experience in the airline industry is required\\*\\*\\* Strong background in data\\-driven strategy, revenue management, and cross\\-functional leadership in a highly matrixed environment. Extensive functional and technical understanding of pricing, trade investment, and product mix management. Advanced analytical skills and strategic planning skills, with expertise in targeting, segmentation, reporting and measurement, multivariate analysis, modeling, sales, revenue management systems, pricing strategies and market analysis.
 



 Experience with partner negotiations. Ability to build strong relationships with internal and external business partners globally. Outstanding collaboration skills, ability to work across teams regardless of reporting lines, to achieve joint outcomes.
 



 Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts and analytics\\-driven findings to non\\-technical collaborators. Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., statistics, engineering, math, science, economics, etc.). Advanced degrees preferred
 



 Minimum of 5\\-7 years in revenue management roles, including at least 2 years in a leadership position. Salary Range: $150,000\\.00 to $225,000\\.00 annually \\+ bonus \\+ equity (if applicable) \\+ benefits The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job\\-related factors
 



 We back our colleagues and their loved ones with benefits and programs that support their holistic well\\-being. That means we prioritize their physical, financial, and mental health through each stage of life. Benefits include: Competitive base salaries Bonus incentives Support for financial\\-well\\-being and retirement Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits (depending on location) Flexible working model with hybrid, onsite or virtual arrangements depending on role and business need Generous paid parental leave policies (depending on your location) Free access to global on\\-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location) Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program Career development and training opportunities American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
 



 Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations. Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.

title: Senior Scrum Master | Hybrid Onsite
description:
The Scrum Master provides effective collaboration, facilitation, leadership, and coaching skills that directly impact our Agile development process and the delivery of our applications. The Scrum Master is a servant leader with the demeanor and acumen to handle most any situation faced by our development teams. This job profile is meant for jobs that are fully dedicated Scrum Masters, not for jobs that have Scrum Master duties as part of their role.
 



**Summary** 




 Are you passionate about team and organizational agility? Do you prefer to foster a culture of self\\-organizing teams who are passionate about continuous improvement? Are you eager to understand and solve organizational agility problems? Are you someone who values coaching and mentoring as your primary means of influencing change? Do you like to use data to measure and track organizational performance and drive improvements? Do you like to aim high and deliver big positive impact?
 



 If this sounds like you, this is the role for you.
 



 Wolters Kluwer Tax \\& Accounting US is looking for a passionate and motivated Senior Scrum Master to join our team. The Senior Scrum Master is an important role to help identify key measures of organizational and team agility and use that data to help influence positive change to improve business outcomes. The Senior Scrum Master seeks to coach and mentor engineering, product management, and development management staff on good agile patterns and practices, how to become self\\-organizing, manage cross\\-team dependencies, always strive for continuous improvement, and how best to navigate planning and decision making in the way that makes business sense.
 



**Responsibilities** 



* Embrace servant leadership and lead agile behavioral change by example.
* Educate, coach, and mentor, teams, and development managers to help improve organizational outcomes thru the application and adaptation of agile frameworks to our business needs.
* Work with a variety of styles (hands\\-on, consultant, or coaching) with new and existing teams of various sizes and locations, depending on need.
* Help identify impediments and dependencies, and work to create and employ effective strategies to overcome them.
* Foster a culture of continuous improvement through the implementation and facilitation of a continuous improvement framework that captures and tracks improvement items through identification, ownership, and completion.
* Facilitate, teach, and/or mentor conflict resolution discussions and alternative approaches to achieve desired business outcomes.
* Drive transparency and trust, identify and measure metrics that assess team agility relative to business performance and use those metrics to help drive improvements.
* Partner with Agile Coaches, Release Train Engineers, and Scrum Masters across the organization to align on driving the intended agile transformation outcomes.
* Facilitates one or more agile teams, each working under the Scrum methodology.



**Experience** 



* 5\\+ years of experience working in software development companies using Agile methodologies as a Scrum Master.
* Have hands\\-on experience utilizing Scrum in software development organizations
* Expert in agile values, principles, and practices and lean ways of working.
* Have demonstrated experience transitioning software teams to an agile framework and/or improving organizational outcomes thru application and adapting agile frameworks to organizations.
* Have excellent presentation, facilitation, communication, and interpersonal skills, including coaching and mentoring
* Experience influencing peers and stakeholders and leading change.
* Passionate about sharing your experiences and knowledge and growing your peers.
* Driven, curious, and a continuous learner who strives to understand the business impact of work.



**Ideal to have** 



* Agile Framework
* SAFe Agilist (SA), SAFe Practitioner (SP), or higher\\-level SAFe certifications







**\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*Ability to work hybrid onsite Tuesdays and Wed\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\***
